And when Deadpool see his wife by a lot of visions during his fights.TADAAAAMMMM !!!!

Good movie. Both parts were great !! > It was funny, excitement was there, action was there, the movie was really well implemented just like the first part. Actors were believable, this story was fine too. > 8/10 *

reviews.review_title: Why does Deadpool need to be serious?
reviews.content:
First off, the movie isn't as bad as some reviews admit here, but definitely not a 8.2(!). So make sure, that you build your own opinion, that's the most important thing. As I scrolled to some reviews here, I was pretty surprised that no one mentioned the major issue the movie has. Where there are few good and even great scenes, like the parachute drop, there are also some really bad one's. Why does Deadpool need to be serious? 
All the background plot with his girlfriend and with "making a baby" was just terrible. First off, Deadpool is insane, why does he need real reason to do anything? I don't want that Deadpool is getting treated like other super heroes. That's unnecessary. I just want Deadpool being Deadpool, weird, violent and crazy. DP doesn't need a "tragic Subplot" that shows his motivation. I couldn't care less about Vanessa (girlfriend). There is unironically one or two scenes that should be sad and tragic. How am I supposed to feel affected by that? Every character is forgettable and exchangeable, besides Deadpool.What I want is: A Plot that is just ridiculos and that DP makes fun about it, violence, 4th wall breaks, action, dark brutal humor, completely crazy storyline etc.
Indeed, there was some of this, but sadly not enough. I will not start with the kid, the huge plotholes or with misplaced jokes. There are plenty other reviews that cover these topics already.I'll rate the movie 56/100Deloron

The first one was funny and on the edge with the R rating. This second came with the same old shtick and R rating but seemed very forced. Throughout the movie I found myself checking my phone due to boredom. I would not recommend, I should have watched Infinity War for a third time.
Absolutely hilarious. Obviously those rating it low didn't get the comedy. I laughed pretty much from beginning to end....

reviews.review_title: A guilty pleasure that shows why breaking the rules sometimes pays off.
reviews.content: Ok, I admit it. During violent movies I will close my eyes periodically. I did it in John Wick. I did it in Kingsmen - The Secret Service. In this movie, I always reopened them too early. It is a violent, foul mouthed, politically incorrect movie about a hero only a mother could love. Oops, theat's his face. Oops, his mother would be appalled. This is the movie his ffans wanted and he delivered. The X-Force concept was executed perfectly. My favorite character was Domino because she reminds me of Angela Davis back in the day. Josh Brolin is tired as Cable but it fits the character. Morena Baccarin as his wife is the personification of hot girl loves bad boy.

Deadpool might not be everybody's cup of superhero tea, but I love the character, and what Ryan Reynolds did with it.
The second installment is really good IMO, with the Fred Savage version being a fun tweak for the elderly Savage fans out there.
Sure, this is not peak cinematic art, but it's pure fun with a dash of feels and tons of cleverness.

reviews.review_title: "You killed Black Tom, you racist son of a b****!"
reviews.content: Deadpool 2 is a film I have mixed feelings about. On one hand it's funny, it's got some great heroes and the action scenes are well choreographed and exciting. But then on the other hand I found some of the humour grating, the story was just a bit too sappy and the character of Rusty who was central to the story was boring and one dimensional. I wasn't a huge fan of Cables or Juggernauts visual style either. But I didn't hate the film, it wasn't as good or original as the first Deadpool but it was was fun and action packed. The violence becomes normalized because it's happening in your face at all times and I lost any sense of shock. But the fight scenes are very well done and I couldn't take my eyes away when there was a fight, the music was always a great fit to. The story about Deadpool trying to kill himself because his girlfriend died and then visiting the dead girlfriend in some afterlife type environment was a bit much for me - the first film was a love story too but not over-the-top like this. One of my favourite scenes was the "big CGI fight" between Juggernaut and Colossus - it was a funny and smart fight and certainly felt like a big comic book battle. Domino was a great addition to the film and even I was thinking initially, "How is luck a super power?" just like Deadpool, but the film did a great job portraying what "luck" powers look like and I was a believer by the end.It's not as a good as the first film in some areas but then better in others. I prefer the more straight forward origin story in the first film but the action scenes are better in this one. The humour is mostly intact but it does feel overdone by the end of the film. It's still a good movie though if you like superheros or gross out action.
I just wondering how an awful film like this could reach 7 of 10!
Very very good I'm just wow!!!!I'm want another dead pool ;)

reviews.review_title: Quite boring. Some good jokes, but poor plot
reviews.content: After really looking forward to this movie, I came out of the cinema slightly disappointed. There are plenty of jokes and actions but the jokes seemed to be a bit meh, I only remembered laughing out loud twice and story line is a bit disjointed. The problem I had is in the DP 1 you had the shock factor of a tongue in cheek marvel character but in this movie that's already gone, so you have to rely on a good plot but unfortunately it lacked that, so I felt a little bit bored by it. I'm not saying it not a good movie but I expected a lot more but sadly I felt let down.5/10
Even better then the first , a must see if you like Marvel Comics or just love Laughing , I love it make more
Best Marvel movie so far. When's Deadpool 3 released?!!!

Deadpool 2 stars Ryan Reynolds, Josh Brolin, and Zazie Beetz. Ryan Reynolds is back as Deadpool or also known as the merc with the mouth and in his new installment he has to protect this kid from Cable who is here to kill him. We all know Ryan Reynolds was born to play Deadpool that's a fact so it would make sense that he would return for the sequel and he kills it like he did in the previous one. I'm really skeptical when it comes to sequels because it's a hit or miss either its better than the first one or it completely falls flat on its face. And I can tell you that it is better than the first one. It's got more action and humor combined so we get to see more jokes from Deadpool and the rest of the cast and crew. But that isn't to say that the movie does have its faults especially in the second act, which started out good, but there was one joke that was carried out for too long that wasn't necessary. Also added to this new installment we have Cable played by Josh Brolin a Terminator who goes back to the past so he can kill this boy who murdered his family in the future. I found Cable to be one dimensional, as we've seen this done multiply times over and over again so that bit I didn't find particularly interesting. I'm not hating on Cable and props to Josh Brolin who took this character very seriously and made everything he said and did with such believability that I have respect for the character even though I don't find him interesting. The real star of this is Domino played by Zazie Beetz. Domino has the power of luck, which sounds kind of lazy as Deadpool puts it, but its so fascinating. I know nothing about this person, but she does have the power of luck on her side and it shows how well they stick that in the movie. Overall, I will say that Deadpool 2 is a perfect sequel without its faults.

I started the movie a little skeptical thinking it couldn't live up to the first one, which was a masterpiece. Then right in the beginning of the movie something seriously sad and uncalled for happens, which I'm still a little mad about. However I actually did make me laugh and it made my boyfriend laugh hysterical. Plenty of physical comedy.

Has its flaws but I can overlook them. It is meta. They just had fun with the story. Gross humor, dark humor, referential humor and also some people probably got high and had epiphanies in a good way to add more hilarious analyses of pop culture. Action is great. Zazie Beetz is awesome like in Atlanta. Ryan great as usual. Josh Brolin is an amazing racist superhero like Ed Norton's American History X Men. What can I say about Morena Baccarin. I couldn't stop laughing even through the 'sad' parts. Especially the delayed opening credits. A surprise monster of a special guest with nice juggs, you will get this if you watch it. Also a shout out to Karan 'Dopinder' Soni the cabbie from the first film, you play that great song from 'Swades'. End Credits are enjoyable as well. You shouldn't have Deadpool a time machine since he is so meta. Not only Canada but probably the whole world thanks you for that one. I leave the flaws for all the negative reviewers who shall make it their life's mission to point them out to you.

reviews.review_title: a movie where a lot of people are having a good time laughing together from the very start to the end, with a lot of bad cgi
reviews.content: First thing first, I thought this movie was gonna be pretty freakin' awesome, which turned out to be a little bit less than my definition of "awesome", but hey it's still good and as usual, deadpool is still unlike any other super/anti-hero we've ever faced so far from the silver screen (same goes for ever movie that stars the merc with a mouth). Unfortunately, the high level of comedy that bounds audiences to their seats for a full two hours was not achieved properly by the cgi which made me almost thinking I was watching a non-disney/pixar movie produced by a startup animation company. Another downgrade form Deadpool 2 also come from an underused character that has so much potential to be interesting and well-received by all DP fans but she was just proving her own worthiness at the very end of the movie. Despite all of that, this is the first time, in the history of a comicbook cinematic universe, where we see deadpool acts as a real hero instead of an anti-hero (the role he plays most of the time in the comic book) without changing his fourth-wall-breaking-with-a-lot-of-adult-jokes attitude which makes us love him even more. I surely can't wait to see his other adventures in the future with deadpool 3, 4, 5, or X-Force 1, 2, 3, 4 etc.P.s. I really hope they have a plan to develop a Deadpool Corp movie, make it happen Marvel, pleasseeee....!!!!!
Action, comedy, emotion and a decent sound track. This movie had it all.

reviews.review_title: not what you would expect from the movie.
reviews.content: This movie was all about deadpool. No other character was given a chance. the x force team was not given any chance. Tried to make it way too emotional. his entire team died he didnt even flinch and was so worried for that kid. Way too many forced jokes. too many scenes for DP and his girlfriend in his psyche. also the action sequence was not as good as the previous one !

reviews.review_title: Not As Good As The First.........
reviews.content: I feel that the First Deadpool Film is a little more enjoyable. All I see in this film is just Deadpool making one Crack after another. And when he's not making Cracks it just feels like a Typical Superhero Film, although Still Funny, I just feel like my Smile just remains longer with the First Deadpool Film. The Juggernaut in this film just feels more like a Bodyguard and less than a Partner to Fire Fist or whatever his name is. And speaking of I just really see a reason for me to feel any sympathy for him through out the whole film not even when they show his Backstory, there just simply not enough there for me to feel Sympathy him. Although the CG Fight with Juggernaut and Colossus was Great its just the way it ended I don't really like. And speaking of unlikable Characters Peter I think it's his name? Was Instantly Unlikable to me Personally. The Parachute scene just feels a little over the top to me. And as for the End Credits Scene although still enjoyable was a little Underwhelming for me. And Sadly there just isn't enough there for me to Care about either the Film or the Characters in the Film for me Personally. Also I'm a little disappointed that Deadpool did not Turned his head to look at us the Audience as much as I would Hoped through the Whole Film. But the upside I did find most of the Humour in the Film still enjoyable. And the last Personal Problem I have with the Film is that as funny as he was I just Feel Deadpool was as funny as he was in the First Deadpool Film Personally. And on a Personal Note I did enjoy those quick Disney Frozen Name Drops. And I liked how they showed how Deadpool's Face was Healing Up. All and all still a Good Film just not one I would Personally own, and as for rewatch? I don't know maybe.
Good action, Great special effects. Totally in keeping with the theme of the 1st movie. This sequel gives you as much and more.

For anyone having doubts this is even better than the original in my opinion. They definitely put more effort in this movie with having a higher budget. I saw this in the Dolby Cinema and its just amazing go and see it you wont regret it.

reviews.review_title: A solid and enjoyable film for adults.
reviews.content: Although not all of the jokes land, most will generate a chuckle, some will have you recoiling in disbelief whilst thinking 'they went there', I would rate this movie as been on par with the first, benefiting from more characters although not all of them are memorable, but I think it is part of the joke, with one particular character who's personality actually matches his persona in the comic book source.I am not sure if the version shown the UK is lightly edited because of the 15 rating whilst the first was an 18 certificate, but still enjoyable and worth the price of admission, and buying on Blu-ray.

If you are a fan of Deadpool you will love this movie! 
If you are some dumb mother ###### who has not seen the first one or has no clue who Deadpool is YOU WILL LOVE THIS MOVIE!!! Make sure you bring the whole family!!! No one should have to go through life without seeing this movie!

reviews.review_title: Lady Luck and Josh Brolin are super
reviews.content: I really loved this movie although I haven't seen Deadpool, I'm a huge MCU fan and totally got all the jokes.I was amazed about Lady Luck's performance, she really shined and she deserved a movie of her own.Josh Brolin made another phenomenal performance, I really like his style of acting and fits his role perfectly.Ryan Reynolds, well everything had said about him, what a class act actor and keeps mr Deadpool to me. He was just awesome.Action packed, dark humor, trillions of references and surprise appearances.Wait until the end with this one!

My Rating-7.7/10Deadpool squares off against cable, a time travel solider inorder to save Firefist and in the process discovers much more. Deadpool 2 is empowered by strong performances by Ryan Reynolds and Josh Brolin who forms the epicentre of this movie.The movie offers excellent fight sequences and humourous scenes which is a treat to watch.Wade's dream sequence with his girlfriend is so beautiful and heart warming.The addition of comic characters like Juggernaut, Cable etc have indeed benifited the movie.The movie share some concepts with terminator franchise which made it a little predictable but the difference in climax provides the uniqueness to the movie.The beginning credits felt as a spoof of james bond movies which was indeed funny.Some real life and movie references made the movie feel like a superhero spoof movie. On the whole deadpool 2 is good but not as great as the first part.

reviews.review_title: " It lives up to the hype"
reviews.content:
Well what can I say, I got what I wanted from this movie. So much more action, comedy, deaths and all over mayhem. Definitely a must watch in my eyes! 
Deadpool 2 really lives up to the hype and o cant wait to see this movie again. I loved the first movie it was so different something marvel haven't really done before. DP2 is definitely better then the first in my opinion and that's strange.. I always prefer the original. I Hope this movie gets the credit it deserves, well done to Ryan and everyone involved definitely in my top ten movies

I went into the movie hoping it wouldn't be a lame attempt to cash in on the popularity of the first one. It definitely wasn't. As Reynolds himself said, the solo formula isn't good for more than a couple movies. Though they pushed it on the sequel it still worked. Mainly because there were so many twists in the movie.
Every time I thought it was getting too serious (I mean really, are looking for serious in a Deadpool movie), they threw a little twist and left you thinking, Ok, what's next?
The action was good, the humor was just as raunchy, and actually pretty topical without being to hipster.
Lots of making fun of himself, and others, throughout the movie.
In short, it was exactly what I expected, and wanted, from a Deadpool sequel.
The post credits scene was almost worth the price of admission by itself.

reviews.review_title: An underwhelming first half saved by a great second half.
reviews.content: The movie started off by repeating some of the jokes from the first one. They killed off the henchmen, had Deadpool kill some guys which upset Colossus, and just repeated an occasional line or moment. When Deadpool was in the prison the movie lost a lot of momentum, he wasn't funny, nothing interesting happened and it just felt underwhelming. When X-Force was introduced and was killed off a few minutes later it brought the film back. The comedy became much better and it moved at a faster pace. The action also significantly improved as well and the characters had more meaning. The end credits scenes were also funny and poked fun at themselves. Ultimately, a slow if not bad start saved by a second half comeback.

reviews.review_title: Messy sequel that lives underneath its strong potential.
reviews.content: "Deadpool 2" is an overall successful attempt at bringing the humor, satire, and playful atmosphere of the first film, while at the same time, does a sloppy and incoherent job. With a new director and all too familiar approach, "Deadpool 2" did something that its sole job was to not follow in similar films of the superhero fashion and be simply ordinary. Perhaps that's why the film is severely disappointing despite it being a genuinely good time at the movies. As expected, Ryan Reynolds nails the character of Deadpool/Wade Wilson. He brings the familiar character back onto the screen while enforcing the theory that maybe only he should play this role. He's hilarious throughout and proves to be the comedic lifeblood of the film. With him around, more comic relief is frankly unnecessary. Josh Brolin creates an interesting antagonist as Cable whose back story and depth feel much more entertaining the the first film's generic villain. Both strong performances and quirky additional characters however, don't save "Deadpool 2" from failing on the screenwriting front. The story is messy not because of its "busyness" but its unfocused theme and message. The film promises a particular theme and emotional tug for its protagonist but is later abandoned and sometimes forgotten altogether. The plot even betrays this path of journey and change for the character and then returns to the third act to try and put those pieces back together. This made the film feel unfocused and not nearly as cared for as its predecessor. Many major plot points as well prove to be unbearably cliched predictable. Drawing obvious inspiration (and maybe a little stealing) from The Terminator anthology and a few other science fiction stories, "Deadpool 2" doesn't feel nearly as fresh or original as it really could've been. Perhaps the film's greatest downfall is these fundamental script problems that keep it from becoming something more than just a sequence to make a sequel. Criticisms aside, the humor (especially a the end) had me not only laughing but unexpectedly busting my stomach. Some jokes landed perfectly and created some of the biggest laughs I've experienced in a movie theater in a long time. At the same time, many jokes fell completely on their faces which really makes the film a hit and miss at the same time. The general progression and tempo of the film is fantastic. "Deadpool 2" moves at a brisk pace and slows down at all the necessary places. Where emotion is the heart of the scene, the filmmakers allow us to feel what emotion is available to draw from. When action sequences kick in, they're thrilling and exciting with hardly any dull moments. Both qualities coupled with constant flakes of Deadpool humor make those sequences enjoyable compounded by more enjoyment. Technically, there are several places in the film with honestly horrendous CGI despite its larger budget. One character in particular was not cared for at all and was painful to watch. I was honestly surprised to see how awful it was and see minimal criticism on this despite the budget it received. Still in the realm of visual aesthetics, the film overall has a better, more cinematic look than the first which feels right. It feels very much in the genre which contributes to a more engaging experience.Overall, "Deadpool 2" is not nearly as good as it should be. It's disappointing and its script is incredibly messy. However, it's a good and funny time at the theaters and should satisfy the majority of the movie going audience and especially its intended audience.

Sequels can often be disappointing. Deadpool 2 is not disappointing at all. Filled with the same level of violence and gore as the first movie, this action packed comedy superhero movie is the best release of the year that I have seen so far.If you enjoyed the first Deadpool movie, do not hesitate to watch this one.
This movie is awesome! I enjoyed it , the ending wasn't the best however, I like this ending better than how the first movie ended
Movie is full entertainment, very good comedy, action scenes were awesome.

reviews.review_title: Mutiple elements, next to each other, in the best way possible
reviews.content:
I regret that I forgot to write this sooner and tonight I remembered how good this movie was.
Deadpool 2 just like the first Deadpool (2016) has everything, good directing, good filmography, good writing, good acting, good story, also it has comedy, tragedy, action, dirty stuff, narrator (Deadpool himself), etc etc. so many to name.
That said, there is barely any film that has all the elements possible and still works out great. When a team of film makers try to induce many of these elements in one work they most likely ruin their own work and it comes out very tacky and unpleasant, but not in this one.
Even though it uses so many cliches, it still has a high level of creativity. Personally I didn't think Deadpool 2 has anything new and I thought it would be only ok or good because it can't have the same creativity and can't have a new way of story-telling, because it was already used in the first one, but surprisingly the movie still had a lot to say.
Also I very much liked that Deadpool is not another (as a figure of spesch) a "hero" - who doesn't kill-.I'm so disappointed in critics because of low rating, it's probably because they mostly look at things technically (as I believe they shouldn't). I also believe in any field, such as music, film, theater and painting when something has a new content, new concept or new way of doing or any kind of innovation -in a good way that comes out suitable and pleasing-, it deserves to get 1 or 2 points out of 10 just for that (unless it the whole thing is rubbish).

Isn't that positive energy! This dead waiter feels like the kind of good student that teachers and parents especially like. They usually wash their feet at home, and then they start smoking, drinking, fighting and swearing in order to integrate into the cool student group in the class. I always want to persuade everyone. Go back with him and take the college entrance examination

What a great adult comedy! This movie is witty, hilarious and have some fantastic one liners. I couldn't stop laughing. Ryan Reynolds was the best! The female kick butt (Lucky) super hero stole the show for me. Heck, I enjoyed this movie better than Avengers: Infinity War. I am going to watch this movie a second time.

Enough is enough. Deadpool 2 is so full off slapstick comedy to the point that it just gets very old and annoying. This isn't a bad movie by any means but sometimes you just need to stop and issue before it's gets too overwhelming. The action scenes safe Deadpool 2 from being a crappy film so that's always great I think. I also have to say that the post credit scene is so hilariously goofy that I just couldn't stop laughing so that's always a plus. Warning, this movie is entertaining and fun to watch, but beware off the going to far comedy. You have been warned.

reviews.review_title: Good, not as good as the original
reviews.content: Deadpool 2 was widely expected and audiences had high expectations regarding the movie, especially since Deadpool was such a blast. I understand all the hype and cult following of Reynolds' over the top crazy and adorable persona, but a movie should be much more than one character thrown into several different situations... Unfortunately, Deadpool 2 was exactly that - several (extremely) funny combined sequences that do not even slightly resemble a functional movie.So, braking this lunacy (in lack of a better word) into several segments seems like the only logical way to review this movie since the movie itself has no logical structure whatsoever. The acting is, by all means, top notch! Reynolds was born to play Deadpool, Brolin created a formidable foe (considering the amount of time he had), Beetz was superb etc. Since the movie itself is structured around characters and their personalities, it is not a surprise they all did a magnificent job. But, that also carries a problem. There is an overabundance of characters that have absolutely no place in this movie. The entire X-force sequence feels like it was a leftover from one of the rewrites. The way it dispenses the characters of the X-force is hilarious, but shows that the screenwriters had no actual idea what to do with all of them. A shame, especially since the whole concept is a generally good idea (can you imagine a team led by Deadpool?). On the other hand, giving Brolin, an actor of the highest caliber (the almighty Thanos) several lines and just a few sequences is a waste of acting. Simply no one believed him to be THAT threatening and mean. Unfortunately, the main villain is underwritten, underused and created a hole in the movie where the bad guy should have stood. Using someone as Dennison to fill that role was a good idea, but he just couldn't perform in the way needed to fill that big of a hole. So, even though the movie doesn't care (at all about anything), the general lack of care at this specific instant created a flaw that was just unnecessary. All in all, regarding the story and characters - NO coherent story, underwritten and underused overabundance of character, and a screw you attitude about it all. Risky, didn't pay of, created flaws.Considering the movies upside - the humor. Even though the movie brings you to tears with laughter, at certain points it feels recycled. There are several instances that killed the joke and/or pun simply because it was already seen in Deadpool. Making it more gory or more explicit or violent is just not doing the joke much good if it feels already seen. In its defense, there are not a lot of these segments, but they are EXTREMELY noticeable. The music was generic not even interesting. Bland and forgettable. Nothing special with a recycled Deadpool rap song.The editing was done as best as it could have been done. Considering the lack of a coherent story or narrative line to hold onto (even though Leitch does quite a good job handling the chaotic narrative) it's a miracle that a coherent movie was even produced. So, congratulations on that.The thing we all must confess is that Deadpool timed it's release PERFECTLY. We are all still in shock and awe with the monumental Infinity war and its sorrow and dark filled ending, so Deadpool simply had a job to make us laugh. It succeeded in that with triumph. But, understanding it had only one job, it left almost every other aspect to wonder on its own, and that may have been a mistake.A decent sequel with a bunch of laughs but... all in all, we really expected more. Not a movie...

Plausible humor, laughability assured. That distorted X men view has finally consolidated with new recruits, a good script, an impressive result. It is genuine, insane and cute. Great work. It not understood why some prefer the first movie. Now one can feel the comics ambience surfacing.

reviews.content: Written by 5 years old geeks .... too much talk for nothing with poor stupid jokes. Really pathetic ! Seriously ?? 4 stars ??? This movie is a demonstration of bad taste and drops heavily down the value of MARVEL BRAND. Now I know you can do really bad movies

reviews.review_title: The movie that made me laugh like no other movie did!
reviews.content: You know what's good about this movie? That it doesn't need to compensate bad acting or lame story with something like good humor, but it still contains a lot of it! So, if you're deciding which movie to watch ( even with family ) than search no more!

reviews.review_title: I'm gonna go see it again!!!
reviews.content: WOW!!! what a movie. Better than the first one. And the action and comedy is put up a level in this one. If you liked Deadpool 1 you are gonna love Deadpool 2.Go see it when you get the chance. Worth my time and it will be worth yours. Enjoy

reviews.review_title: A well deserved and lives up to the hype that it was given
reviews.content:
The original Deadpool introduced us to a R rated version of the x men universe and the sequel further establishes the universe with deadpool in it and deadpool 2 follows Wade/Deadpool learn the importance of family and responsiblity and also gives us a amazing version of the villian Cable who is so Badass that Josh Brolin really makes the character from the comics to be brought alive and Julien Dennison is a great fit for Russel and becomes some sort of son to Wade which fits with a complicated relationship they develop. And the X force storyline is also one of the reasons that you can fall in love with Deadpool 2 and they bring the rag tag team together from the comics.
Leading the cast as always is the super talented Ryan Reynolds who is back as Deadpool and gives a always funny but also some times emotional performance and also making their return from the original is Morena Baccarin,
T.J. Miller,Leslie Uggams,Karan Soni and Stefan Kapicic they are even better than in the orginal deadpool and continue on bringing such amazing talent and life into their characters. The breakout star of Deadpool 2 and a native of New Zealand is Julian Dennison who plays Russel/ Firefists and i loved his preformace he enbodyed what it was like to be in your early teens and being a muntant which we saw lots of in the X Men movies and played to perfection in Deadpool 2 he was by far one of my favorite parts of the movie hands down.
Zazie Beetz is another new face in deadpool 2 and she plays the lucky mutant Domino who is played to perfection and she was not at all a waste of talent and she brings a sort of sassy attitude which can clash with deadpool and she was a great new charecter to explore in the this one. And Finally the villian of deadpool 2 Cable played by superhero movie superstar who is also Thanos in the MCU Josh Brolin he is so great as Cable and his backstory made me feel for this villian unlike Ajax in the last movie their was no real reason he did what he did but with Cable we understand after losing his wife and daughter he must prevent their deaths and this why he is so cool and is by far the best villian in the X Man universe.
Overall I really enjoyed Deadpool the music was on point and the story was very enjoyable and the action scences were rich with violence and gore that we should expect from deadpool although I thought there was a lack of real meta moments which made me fall in love with the orginal movie and the pop culture refernces while good were seemed to be toned back a little more than in the last movie which may be fine for some people but for me it sorta hurt my viewing experince and also the swearing was also toned back as well which was something that did not work for me as I said it could be fine for some people but for me it was not really a deadpool movie without those things.
I gave it a 9/10 an i though it was an enjoyable watching experence and i can't wait to see what Ryan Reynolds will come up with for the 3rd movie or maybe a X Force movie.

This movie has almost nothing wrong with it! The family-friendly theme actually stuck, which is not something you'd expect from the Merc with a (expletive-filled) mouth. This movie was great, the characters were great, and the 4th wall breaking jokes were mere appetizers to the round after round of laughter this film had me going through. This movie would'be been graded higher if DP got his girl, but I feel like that might have been a setup for the third. Overall, an incredible movie that deserves to be included in the Movie of the Year category for 2018. Watch it!

I liked it; I can't say u will too!If u are not watched and never got to know the style of this movies genre! I don't know how u will take it; this is not a common or well mannered super hero movie!This is bad,dirty,foul mouth super hero movie with a lot of vulgarities and trolls to many movies,studios; Don't take it seriously, its just for fun!This movie is done what sequels should do,double upon what the previous movie did,deadpool 2 succeeded it,full on one liners, self praise and teasing ,funny screenplay with highly energetic performance by Ryan Reynolds he **** nailed it,i was entertained,my rating 8.4( may be you dont feel 8.4,i dont care)

reviews.review_title: The merc with the mouth shines again
reviews.content: Here's my review of Deadpool 2. So Ryan Reynolds is back again as the Merc with the mouth and he does justice to the role by being the Johnny Depp to capn jack and the rdj to iron man. The movie is directed by the guy who made John wick and that results in the movie having zero shaky cams and solid action scenes unlike the first one. I also liked how there was a lot going on in this movie compared to the first one's linear plot. The kid who played Ricky in the Wilderpeople movie is in this and he does a really good job. Josh Brolin was great as thanos this year , and was good as cable ,but I can think of a hundred actors who could've played the same role . The pop cult references were neat and some of the jokes landed very well.The cgi however was not that impressive for such a big franchise, no I'm not saying it's like "Henry Cavill mush" like cgi , its just that it was revealing. In the end Dp 2 is the perfect sequel the first one can ask for with great action , memorable characters , studio assaults and probably the funniest fourth wall / post credits scene in movie history.

I really liked the first Deadpool, but this movie does not have the same charm. The excess of jokes, extreme violence and politically correct policies spoils so much the movie that they become unbearable. The opening song is boring, and does not fit the story. The CGI starts reasonable, however in the middle of the movie become bad (Do not get to be level Justice League). The biggest problem of Deadpool 2 is in the weak script that sounds so childish and lacking a solid tangle. Some action scenes were good for example when Cable appears in prison. The rest of the action scenes did not excite me. But why put the X Force team in the movie? To kill the whole team ... what a waste of the scene. The worst is the Firefist kid. The boy reminded me so much of Dakota Fanning in the War of the Worlds. That there were times when I wanted his death. One thing I did not like was putting Deadpool after the death of the beloved wanting to commit suicide. In today's world, suicide is a huge problem. And for mentally weak people you get the wrong message. (The same would be said in the previous film when Deadpool advises Dopinder to kidnap the rival).
In the end, Deadpool was made for money only. And it does not even have the passion seen in the previous film. For a Marvel movie I expect quality and passion, but this film has other priorities.

I'm not into X-Men or the comic genre in general, but I loved the first DP movie so was eagerly anticipating the sequel. It did not disappoint. 
I dislike unnecessary hyperbole save to say this movie deserves them all. I laughed, I cried and grimaced in places. Ryan Reynolds is now, and for some considerable time in the future, my guilty pleasure. 
Thoroughly recommended!

I see lots of reviews complaining Deadpool 2 has no plot, and I have to disagree. If anything, the first really had no plot at all, whereas 2 sets up the plot of the film and the surprisingly heartwarming message of the film, the real meaning of FAMILY throughout. The early X-Force characters introduced in the film were wasted (quite literally) and Domino wasn't nearly developed enough, which is why I dinged this one star off.Some complain there isn't enough humor in it. Personally, I think it's the right amount. The first and its 5-jokes-a-minute pace made you miss some of them due to laughter and felt like someone with ADD picked the pace. Overall, very funny film with a superior plot to the original, exactly enough violence, and a perfect setup to make a full-on X-Force film where Mr. Pool is only ONE of the main characters, not the only star. A complete film that is surprisingly heartwarming.

Let me start off by saying this is a better movie than the first one. The story the humor the story all fits perfect. From the start you will be hooked however things takes a turn when the movie shifts its focus from Cable to the Russell. From the trailers it all seems like cable would be a badass and he in fact was but the movie completely shifted away from him. Why would you take such a strong character and not utilize it. He could have been taken seriously but instead he suddenly becomes Deadpool partner when his plan is revealed. Not only that he saves Deadpool at the end. It was all about that kid which pretty much destroyed Cable character. Because of this I had to give the movie an 8/10 Overall it's a great flick and must watch

But, clearly, people enjoyed it and it made a lot of money so good job. 
Its worth a watch. I just wouldn't pay the money to see it in theater again. Wait for the DVD.

This really is worth a watch however if you are a fan of Deadpool and Marvel.

This movie was great. Not much else to say. Why?Without spoilers:
This movie will get comedy of the year award.
Romantic Movie of the year award.
Dramatic Movie of the year award.
Nominated for best Action movie of the year award.
Best sequel of the year award.
Best Movie song of the year award.

And waiting to buy the second on blue ray.Oh that's great, you made it this far into my movie review.. little by little you realize this is some troll of a review, and its probably Arnold Schwarzenegger or the guy at best buy who ask you : "hey do you work here?" when your dressed in blue with khaki pants. Then you look at the clock and think, It's certainly not slade wilson, but probably Deadpool.And dont forget always stay at least 5 minutes after the movie ends
Awful really awful the whole plot made no sense! Was dragged out way too long and the laughs not great the first one was brilliant but this was awful

Deadpool 2 just delivered what it promised. The comedy and action was over the top and Ryan Reynolds rocked once again. The plot was engaging and thrilling at times. I would say it was one of the best comedies I saw recently. But if you are an Indian, personally I won't prefer you to watch it from theaters in India as the censor board cut off some good scenes.

HE IS BACK!!! And this time he isn't alone. Back in 2016, we saw the rise of an anti - hero, Deadpool, who was foul mouthed but at the same time witty and adorable. So fortunately, the expectations for DP2 will be higher. So how's the film? Let's take a look. But before that the plot... Wade Wilson a.k.a Deadpool is a now a well know mercenary. After the murder of his wife Vanessa, he decides to commit suicide, but is saved in time by Colossus, who in turn asks him to join the X - men. Meanwhile, DP takes the responsibility of protecting a mutant child, Russelles a.k.a Firefist from a time travelling soldier Cable. 
 That's all I can tell u about the plot. The film is however slightly better than the first part. Anyway, that doesn't , mean that it's devoid of R rated violence . There r cuss words, body being teared apart, wire plugged into a#@ and so on. Anyway this is the best superhero movie this year along with Infinity war. The technical parts of the film were all good. Be it the usage of the background score during action scenes or the visual effects, all were done neatly. Dialogues were witty and has a lot of references to the old and latest released films. Action scenes were slick and not overdone. Editing was good , but there was some dragging felt towards the middle portion. 
 Now to the performances. Ryan Reynolds just rocked as Deadpool. His performance is sure to be appreciated. Josh Brolin as Cable was at par with Reynolds. Also the reference to his character, "THANOS" was funny. Another memorable performance was that of Zazie Beetz as Domino. Stefan Kapicic as Colossus had a small role but his scenes with DP are sure to bring in laugh out loud moments. Rest of the supporting cast were good, especially Karan Soni as Dopinder.
So all in all, DP 2 is superior than its first part . Go in and have a BLAST..... My rating- 4/5
P.S: Don't miss the mid credit scenes. They r the best seen in recent times....

This "film" is literally one X-Force sequence away from being unwatchable. The "franchise" is a one trick pony that was well executed in the first film, but at this point it is a standard sequel rehashing a formula that relied on its fresh voice and style, both of which are shot by this point. Reynolds is once again amazing, but it literally all falls on him to carry this soulless outing.

Like the first movie the sequel of our favorite antiheroe was absolutely awesome.The film has all these ingredients that we loved at the first part and also better plot, more interesting characters and a lot of humor and satirical references.

reviews.review_title: A fun action film for fun people.
reviews.content: This has to be one if my favorite action flicks that I have ever seen in my entire life. Usually, sequels don't meet up to my expectations, but this one did just that! I meant to write this review sooner, but here it is now. This film mashed all of my favorite things for an action/comedy into one movie, talented and humorous writing, satisfying action sequences, a good plot, and good ol' fun. This didn't out rank the first deadpool for me, as I do love them both the same, because I definitely like going back to the first one for a much more simple action comedy, and back to this one for the incredible writing, perfect plot, and the many more Deadpool gags. I can't stress enough how much Ryan Reynolds fits this role perfectly, especially due to his actual personality. Vanessa's death definitely striked me as fairly depressing, but it did fit with the rest of the story/plot. One thing I wished for in this flick that I didn't get was seeing the X-force get more of a role in the film, and see them fight along Deadpool, instead of dying instantly due to severe winds, but other than that, the film was amazing, and couldn't be any more of a perfect action comedy, with the perfect cast.Also, I definitely got a really good kick out if the alternate time travelling gag that played during the credits, my family couldn't stop laughing neither at the baby legs joke. I suggest you give this flick a watch if you hadn't already!-Jaret

reviews.review_title: Best damn super hero movie franchise ever!
reviews.content: Bar none. The first one was awesome. Number 2 - it'll take a few more viewings to decide if it's better than the first, but who cares, it's awesome and it will make you laugh provided you have a sense of humour. If not - try every other super hero franchise, they're all pretty much the same!
If you were a fan of the original Deadpool then you should like this one as well. Same type of humor. Definitely worth a watch
This movie was insanely funny!!! It had one of the best after credit scenes (obviously) and the sarcasm from Ryan Reynolds was just godly. Everyone go see it!!

I gave it a 7 because they put a lot of effort/money into production value but other than that this movie is forgettable. I doubt it will me anymore memorable than most of the other marv/DC comic movies.

reviews.review_title: Not sure what movie the haters saw...
reviews.content: Love, love loved it! Too much overthinking from many of the reviewers, just sit back and enjoy it. I didn't notice the CGI, all I know is I sat in a theatre with people laughing out loud. I didn't want to see a clone of the original and it wasn't, it was funnier, the addition of better characters and more froms some from the original. The only downside was the non appearance of Stan Lee.Just sit back with a big tub of popcorn and enjoy it.And don't forget to stay for the crazy credits, best ever.
a perfect sequel to the firstjust as or even more hilarious than the firstintroduces more fun charactersperfect blend of action and comedy

reviews.review_title: Absolutely enjoyable: funny, engaging, edgy, action packed
reviews.content: After a successful debut, it is often tough for superhero movies to offer a sequel, which doesn't go totally above and beyond (and fail, due to that gigantism). I had my reservations for Deadpool 2 before I have seen it because of that. The team-up, the possible bigger scale of the story.Fortunately Deadpool still stays a widely funny and focused movie. The movie seems less raw... but this is also a good thing.The team-up "makes sense" and never gets out of the right focus. The investment of the viewer is no result out of an armageddon-like global situation, but out of the personal tragedy of Wade Wilson. The story writing is clever and the movie is just very well crafted. Off course the best thing are the jokes of Deadpool. This time, it seems that the writers were more subtle in breaking the 4th wall... however the occasions are now far more integrated ("as dark as the DC universe"). There is just not much, you could possibly desire more. It is a movie, which will be entertaining for multiple viewings - as the jokes which Deadpool cracks, are just too plenty to get at the first time times... and this is a good thing. About the team-up - the assembly of (the original?) X-Force is hilariously funny - but thankfully kept short. Domino the "remaining" character of the "original" team is really cool from the time she is introduced in the movie.Cable the antagonist is also "well crafted". I have to say, that the CGI and practical effects of his mechanical parts could have been done better. But it is never too disturbing or distracting, that it would be an issue.With the big elephant released just beforehand (Infinity War) I really hope, that Deadpool 2 has a chance to shine. It is for sure a movie, which is at least as good as the "big" Marvel movie - if not better. I really enjoyed the tight scope of the movie. The imperfection of the characters and the humanity in them. As nerd, only one thing has been missing for me: that Deadpool pulls ridiculous weapons (and other stuff) out of thin air.There is not much more to say. If you are old enough (the movie is still R-rated) and like action movies, you should see Deadpool 2.

reviews.review_title: It's the gift that just keeps on giving
reviews.content: Broke the general rule of don't see the sequel.. so glad I did

reviews.review_title: Strange movie which is all and nothing
reviews.content:
Deadpool 2 is a strange movie. It is a mix of a comedy, although the longer the movie lasts the more annoying the character Deadpool becomes, SF and an action-movie. It has a lot of violence in it which in a certain way is funny but also is gross. The reality is not present and off-course in a movie as this it is more or less logical but mutants with superpowers which can be contained by a "Radioshack"-like necklace? Come on....
Then this Juggernaut who is so strong that with one blow a bridge and heavy truck are damaged but is unable to escape his prison? And than the "Terminator'-twist? Wow, that is the best the writers could do?
No, this Deadpool 2 is a big disappointment especially compared to the first movie. Do not waste any money on this lame movie!
Not funny, worst Marvel movie ever, horrible cgi, far left woke ideology and very cringy.👎👎
We need more movies like these. Never thought that DP2 could actually be this good. It was just amazing entertainment. And everyone who doesnt agree probably liked TLJ. People without taste.

Well i never write reviews but this movie is just amazing. It delivers everything you expected and more . Its an adult Comic anti-Hero , and Ryan is just what it was needed to give this character a body . The plot is good but the R rated scenes are just hilarious , I just hope we will see a spiderman-deadpool R rated movie soon .

reviews.review_title: Great Movie... Too Bad we are still in the Infinity War Daze!
reviews.content: This franchise inspires you to be badass. It also is the best embodiment of creative expression, satire and dark humour. A lot of DC and Marvel references, a lot of bad words, sexual undertone and violence. It holds no bar with its bold and beautiful content and attention to detail. Side actors were good, Ryan Reynolds was truthful in his portrayal of the foul mouthed superhero and Josh Brolin- that guy is making a mark- first Thanos and now Cable... Enjoyable journey that will leave you overwhelmed- though the storyline was a little weak and Juggernaut wasn't used wholeheartedly. I felt the maker could have made it a little more grand and way more glorified... But then you have to make it like a Deadpool Standalone not an Infinity War spectacle.Last- we would really like to see a Wolverine-Deadpool Movie.

reviews.review_title: Deadpool's Formula Equals Hit for Summer Fun
reviews.content: There's something about an opening scene, it either instantly grabs you or it doesn't. Some movies have a set up to an opening scene, but they still have an opening scene. Throw in a classic hit from your childhood and you find yourself already liking the movie. Its a cheap, simple formula, but it works. Deadpool 2 started out just that way. Cue the music Dolly! From there, Deadpool 2 never took itself serious, so it could mock itself, other movies and even its star. Incorporate lots of famous movie quotes and references throughout and you've created something people will talk about at the water coolers the next day. Or in my case, 4-O. Now, the only thing missing from the formula is will it be a hit. Mix in some comedy, action and a few Easter Eggs leaving us wanting more, and you have just that - a box office hit.Deadpool teased us enough with the expanded Marvel Universe but yet focused specifically on the lead's story. Running time of was just under 2 hours where realistically, they could have cut about 10-15 minutes to make run smoother with less slow points.Without spoiling the main film, you may leave after Cher completes her soundtrack as there is no final-final Easter Egg after the credits, like most Marvel films. I didn't expect Nick Fury to come to Deadpool saying he was putting together a team, but seeing Jean Gray and Cyclopes would have been awesome. Oh well, still a fun summer movie!

Friends, real ones, never really give up on You. And some people in our lives, are worth more than all the money in the world. We may from time to time, give up on ourselves, yes this is true; but then their are those special people in our lives, who seem to be able to pull us through. I am amazed that this group can find a way to express this loving sentiment, in a block busting action move. I found myself in tears, by the mastery of the image, music, and message cobination used in this film. Going to see it again.

Great action work, sound and visuals, but the hyperactive use of movie in-jokes is tired and distracting. It will be beter without so many, though that is just me.
Otherwise it's a welldone bash and smash flick.

There is one thing about a Deadpool movie, the story leaves no doubts once the movie is over. Like, "so what happened to this or that?, what happens next etc?". There is no confusion in the air. It's just simple action and comedy. But I gotta say, it's not as interesting as the first one. Much crowd was laughing over scenes that weren't funny at all. Maybe because they thought, "hey, we are watching a Deadpool movie, it's funny by default". Story needed much fine tuning. Josh Brolin is a much better Thanos than Cable. Ryan Reynolds, this guy, MUST NOT EVER DIE. He is pure GOLD.Peace Out!

Oh man. So frickin hilariously, violently, grossly, brutally AWESOME! It's even better than the first one. Will definitely have to watch it again to get all the punch lines cos you're so busy laughing to catch them all. Some interesting cameos by Brad Pitt (The Vanisher) & Matt Damon (the guy in the pick-up truck talking about toilet paper) & some of the cast from X-Men First Class.Josh Brolin is just wow as Cable. To quote Graham Norton, "someone might have a nerd-gasm" watching Josh Brolin three weeks apart, first as Thanos & then as Cable.You gotta stay through the credits to see a segment of Deadpool time traveling. IMDb-8.3/10 (says it all). Great soundtrack too.

It is so full of references that it makes it very fun, the action is very well achieved and everything is very good. Some situations seem ridiculous in both Cable and his trip and his decision to stay and ignore his own family (which was the only reason he traveled back in time), but removing that all is very good.

I won't say much with the unconscious risk of giving away some of the myriad of one liners and inside jokes, but this was a sequel that exceeded its predecessor. As usual, see it to THE END of all credits. Two thumbs way up!

reviews.review_title: "The Greatest Sequel since Human Centipede II" -- Deadpool
reviews.content: "Deadpool 2" is the greatest superhero sequel since "The Dark Knight." Its rapid-fire meta humor, immense hilarity, and non-stop entertainment marks the second coming of Jesus. Ha just kidding. Let's be real, littleging12 is writing another wordy and pretentious review so he can pretend that he has a big penis, when in reality he has a chode. With these reviews, littlejizz hopes to deceive uneducated Mexican immigrants into thinking he is Conan O'Brien.In his review of "Deadpool," littleging12 stated that "what holds it back from greatness is its superficially structured story, unimpressive CGI action, ineffective resonance and bland one-dimensional characters excluding the titular character." If he was anymore pretentious, he'd get nominated for an Oscar. "Deadpool 2" improves over the original with a better story, better side characters, better CGI action, bigger heart, and smaller penis. What holds it back from getting a 10/10 is littleging12's bull sh$!$y rating system. In all seriousness, "Deadpool 2" is very entertaining, hilarious, and one of the better sequels in recent memory. It may not be the most sophisticated or artistic movie, but it delivers everything you could want out of an irreverent superhero comedy. Deadpool is the character Ryan Reynolds was born to play and he will hang up his suit (and his dildo) as a pop culture icon. 8.5/10

This movie was amazing. It was presented as this big team up movie in the trailers but somehow still maintains the isolated cast that made the first one great. If you liked the first deadpool, this movie is like that, but the jokes and violence are turned up to eleven

Deadpool 2 same as the first film is a mixed bag. Obviously the studio wanted to stuff their pockets full of cash again, so they didn't dare to stray from the established formular.As a comedy Deadpool 2 works really well. The gags range from genuinely funny to slightly cringe worthy. If you expect to get a few laughs out of this you will not be disappointed. I promise.On the other hand, if you are a X-Force comics fan, stay away as far as possible. The casting is hilariously bad. The middle aged Hollywood actor who plays cable is absolutely mis-casted. Beats me why they didn't ask Dolph Lundgren to play cable.
As mostly with these superhero cash grab fests the whole cast looks like cosplay gone horribly wrong. And of course the lameness doesn't stop there. The CGI design sucks balls as well. Juggernaut looks like a deflated Juggernaut Jr, and Colossus looks like they barrowed him from a cheapo Saturday morning kids show.Seriously if you cant even do Superhero characters the slightest justice, stop trying. It's embarrassing and it outs you as the money grubbing dolts that you are.
This time, the sequel actually exceeds its predecessor. It's bigger, funnier and more re-watchable. Ryan Reynolds and co. clearly understand the character. My favourite line: 'I'm Batman!'

My first review here! i'll do my best.I wasn't a fan of the first deadpool, i found it forgettable. I had no idea where deadpool went or who he fights. Probably not my sort of film. However i really enjoyed this one.There's plenty of laughs, the majority of which hit the spot. The film is good at laughing at itself, like Deadpool saying "here comes a big CGI battle!" And "that's lazy writing!" There's good character development with Deadpool learning to fight for the greater good, in his own way. Vince Cable is a serious character whose a good foil for deadpool. The other support characters are used effectively. If you loved the first Deadpool, you'll love this one even more. It has all the laughs plus a better story. But if you're the politically correct type of person, Deadpool is not a character for you. The after credit scenes are hilarious, stay behind for those!

reviews.review_title: It just gets funnier and funnier
reviews.content: The amazing acting and script writing help boost the movie but what makes Deadpool so iconic is Ryan Reynolds acting and improvising! It's great

I really liked the first one, hoped this would be just as good.sadly that is not the case, not a good movie. not the clever crude writing of the original, here its just crude and unfunny.dumb plot, dialog, feels bad man.

Deadpool 2, much like the first film in the series (which will no doubt become a trilogy) is very clearly a passion project for Ryan Reynolds. His sheer dedication to portraying what we see in the source material and putting it to film is something that unlike other super hero blockbusters can only be achieved through a sense of cairlessnes from Director David Leitch and writers Paul Wernick and Rhett Reese. This is due to the nature of the title character himself, the Deadpool that readers know from the comics doesn't care about studio rivalry, copyright infringement or timeline consistency. This is a character that says and does what he wants, when he wants and it's because of this that the Deadpool films have secured and maintained their own unique brand of humour that simply couldn't be achieved by any other character. Of course all humour is subjective though and one could make the argument that Deadpool 2 has an over reliance on pop culture references which is especially risky territory when it comes to comedy as anyone who is not as pop culturally aware as the common geek will be left wondering why everyone else in the theatre has tears of joy in their eyes while they're sat quietly wondering what the hell just happened. It's clear that the writers aren't going for mainstream appeal when they reference obscure 90's comic book trivia and why should they when this brand of humour worked so well in the first one? The plot keeps things simplistic and somewhat relatable, it's a semi unorthodox family tale with a revenge plot woven into it which is the motivation for Josh Brolin's mercenary from the future "Cable". The title character's emotional journey isn't anything we haven't seen before but it is a refreshing change of pace from the gorgeously gory action sequences we've all come to expect from this character. Deadpool's healing abilities are incorporated into the action in far more more interesting ways than what we've seen from Hugh Jackman's "Wolverine". There is no over use of shaky cam and the chase sequences are top notch and easy to follow. Overall "Deadpool 2" is a sequel that has an excellent blend of humour, action and emotion. It's certainly not something that will appeal to more traditional viewers who value immersion above all else but if that's what you're looking for then why would you even consider this film? 8/10

Ryan Reynolds returns as Wade Wilson/Deadpool, this time he also shares a screenwriting credit and yet again he does a brilliant job. Stealing every scene he's in Reynolds really carries the film with his quips, constant forth wall breaking and snarling sense of humour. Like the first film, he commentates throughout to great effect. It's really hard to imagine anyone else in the role as he completely nails it. Josh Brolin plays Cable, a half mutant/half robot who comes from the future - fully equipped with gadgets and one liners. Brolin like everyone else is clearly having a good time. He is overly serious with some great nods to the Terminator films. Child actor Julian Dennison from Hunt From the Wilderpeople plays foul mouthed Russell who shoots fire from his hands. He has a messed up backstory that gives him some much needed depth. He's basically the John Connor of the film as he is chased down by Cable throughout. The opening credits are a brilliant throw back to the Bond series accompanied by a Celine Dion song. There is a team recruitment scene similar to the X-Men films which goes horribly (yet hilariously) wrong. Also the constant jokes about last years Logan will have you bursting out laughing. The list is endless and its jam packed with so much of everything. It even makes room for some interesting narrative changing and on top of that has some emotional heft. All of the original characters return from Colossus, taxi driver Dopinder, Weasel and Negasonic Teenage War Head. Initially they don't get much to do, but they turn up again for the extremely over the top climax. With an already bloated cast there was no need to introduce Domino or Yukio as like the others, never really get much to do. John Wick and Atomic Blonde director David Leitch does a fine job making the action scenes very stylised and brutal. He also handles the comedy well too, the many gags and references mostly hit the mark. They poke fun at near enough every comic film of the last decade including themselves. The film is so self aware of its flaws and imperfections that it would be stupid to over analyse it. Deadpool 2 does what any great sequel does, it builds upon the first film and results in being much better. 20th Century Fox may be going downhill with the X-Men franchise but they have struck gold with the Deadpool series. Deadpool 2 is a forth wall breaking exciting thrill ride best seen on the biggest loudest screen.

The film is a complete, absolute, inexpressible delight!!! An extravaganza of humor that creates a great mood! All the ingredients needed for a great entertainment movie are in place in Deadpool 2, in the right proportions, brought to the right degree! Not a second of boredom and sagging - the film rushes forward at breakneck speed, delivering great pleasure! Action scenes are incomparable: spectacular, inventive, with high-quality choreography. Reynolds, as always, just handsome! Once again, he convinced me of the accuracy of getting into the image of a chatty mercenary. Thanks to him and Force X for an awesome film, which will now often brighten up my evenings!

reviews.review_title: dark humor through out the movie
reviews.content: Same hilarious content and script as the first deadpool. fun and entertaining to watch, some violent and the jokes only american can understand. still a superhero movies, tons of action and computer graphics. the story line is just enough to ride over the entire movie, yes, we only want to see killing and all those incredible action in all the deadpools. i like the coin ending at the end, it is kind of a twist. i am sure there will be deadpool 3, just like mi series, keeping running and making profit.

reviews.review_title: Good movie with some lazy writing
reviews.content: This movie was good because the plot was original and there were some truly funny scenes and some pretty cool action scenes as well. That being said, I lost track of how many times they referenced the original movie. Every time I heard a joke that was from the original movie, I always thought "wow these writers really don't know what the fans want". I never heard a copied joke and thought "oh haha it reminds me of the first one because it's the same line from the first one". This happened way way WAY too many times for a marvel movie, considering they basically own hollywood at this point. Again, the rest of the movie was good enough to overshadow the laziness in writing, but it's still there and it makes me mad. The best way for a sequel to pay homage to the original is by leaving it the hell alone, not by leaching off the funny parts of it in an attempt to get some cheap easy laughs that the other writers already got the first time. Worst part of this situation: it probably will only get worse in the next one. Still a good movie, 8/10 stars is still good! But lazy writing.

reviews.review_title: This is the sequel we all need.
reviews.content: Deadpool 2 is a much needed comic relief (pun intended) after we were left devastated in Avengers: Infinity War.It's bigger and better than the original in every way.The X-Men franchise is still alive and kicking thanks to Logan and Deadpool.
Like Marvel films better than some do, have never been and never will be part of this ridiculous MCU vs DCU war, and the positive critical reception drew me in to seeing 'Deadpool 2'.
From beginning to end we had a blast watching this movie, sequels are hard to get right but Reynolds fired on every cylinder to give us a movie better than its predecessor!

Laughter and tears, sad and moved. Deadpool 2 is not a pure comedy. Although it's not as good as Deadpool 1, it's not bad either.
P.S. Brad Pitt amused me.

I really enjoyed this movie. When I went to watch it I laughed like crazy, couldn't stop thinking about it and went to see it again next morning. Though I loved first one more than sequel. Even though I liked it more than Deadpool 2 this had more queerness, diversity and gore which was delight to see. I really loved the whole "screw you" attitude in this.All the gay moments made me so happy and the fact how pansexual Wade was was what I hoped for this sequel and I didn't get disappointed. Also Negasonic's girlfriend was so cute and she was introduced so well. They didn't make it a big deal and they weren't too smushy or glamoured. The relationship between two lovers was normal and that was pretty much it. All we needed to see.Cable and Domino both were amazing characters. I liked the way Cable and Deadpool teased each other and how they worked together. I also loved how Domino and Deadpool supported each other and X-Force even tho it went to crap in seconds. It was especially funny how Cable copied mr. Pool's trash talk. And the mutual Thanos joke was spot on. Somehow Cable's "he even runs like pervert" comment was too funny for me and I loved it. Domino's care free way of being and her ability was hilarious and entertaining. I really liked the way they portrayed her and many other characters in this. Zazie Beetz did wonderful work in this.Though this movie was a bit all over the place and the X-Force fiasco was bit unnecessary. Tho can't say it wasn't funny. Heck that's only thing that mildly bothered me.Also let's not forget the amazing soundtracks and songs that were made to this. They were perfectly fitted into themes and mood of the said scene. I didn't like the X-Men arriving parts of the soundtrack, but it wasn't due them being bad and they actually were spot on in the scenes.The reason I love whole Deadpool francise is cause it's not too serious and isn't afraid to be dark and dirty. Deadpool isn't pure or perfect, but still he's comfortable and confident as he is. I see alot myself in Deadpool and what I can't relate to is something i wanna learn to become. This movie hit my queer ass trash heart in just the right places and I've been in such and euphoria since I saw it. It's really weird how one movie can make one so gleefully happy.

reviews.review_title: A movie for adolescent with foul language wherever possible.
reviews.content: One liners are the only thing that works in the movie. The first part has a good story and makes the audience wait for more. The sequel disappoints, and seems to be a harried one. But you will love the protagonist character as it is so uniquely wonderful.

I can't believe the negative reviews this movie has got! I mean it's Deadpool! What did you guys expect? Or is it the butthurt JL fans? Anyhow, let's get the thing clear and loud. Deadpool 2 is Super Duper Fun! 
Having watched the Super Duper Cut last night which has alternative jokes, added scenes and roughly 15 minutes of extra footage, within the 1st 5 minutes I knew I'm in for a ride and it was a madcap quirky ride, and I savour each moment of it. The director change thankfully didn't effect the movie. In fact, I would say the Jokes are funnier, the action sequences more better. Ryan Reynolds is a riot. He was born to play Deadpool(and to screw Green Lantern). It seems Deadpool has completely become his baby, not only does he use self depreciating humor but also shares writing credits and produces the movie. Maybe in the future, we might see him directing as well. Josh Brolin, after his brilliant turn in Infinity War, plays Cable here, and blends in well. We will see more of him in the future movies. As DP puts it, X Force is nothing but a scheme by Fox to keep Brolin employed! 
Among the downsides, I would say the plot isn't that strong. Though I personally didn't mind it. The irreverent tone of the movie doesn't go with a serious plot. As long as it's fun, you know it's a good movie.
The Mid credit scenes are a riot. Especially the bonus scene. That was ROFL. 
Overall, don't listen to the purists. If you like your movies fun, you'll love DP 2. 
Pump the hate breaks haters!
Pointless weak script and pathetic jokes! Deadpool 1 was way better. One of the most boring movie Marvel ever made!

So many many people have put 1 star, claiming first movie better and so forth. What did they expect from a sequel if the first made as much as it did. Why would they change the formula for the second. Honestly so many people feel that each time a movie is an adaptation of either a book or comic that the movie has to be made to their expectations. You forget the basics as maximus put it are you not entertained. Me yes. Others instead of projecting what it should be or shouldn't just relax and enjoy it. 
Furthermore as said it is better than first.

I enjoyed the additional cheeky humor that Fred Savage and Deadpool brought to the DP2 movie.Disappointed that the Motion Picture Association (MPAA) would rate the movie as PG-13 and bleep out words like f*** & s***, but not bleep out curses toward God or Jesus, for example. If you're going to make a movie PG-13, it would be great if the movie be made PG-13 all the way, not halfway.Glad that some of the proceeds ($1 from each ticket) is being donated to the Fudge Cancer Foundation. Cancer still sucks.

PROS:
Ryan Reynolds's delivery of Deadpool lines is never not funny;Cable and Domino are good additions to the cast;The 4th-wall breaking is out of control, usually with hilarious results;Russell (a clear nod to Logan's X-23) is funny as well;The entire post-credit, time-travel story;Stunt sequences are gold, especially the long shot in the sauna;The X-Force auditions.CONS:
Sometimes the humor is a bit forced and unnecessary;The final act is too long;Some shaky CGI.

I don't know if the franchise will go into double digits but at least go for a SAGA. As in more than 3. Deadpool, Domino and Cable were extraordinary and pure fun to watch. Now we'll of course want more. Well done on the franchise repairs as well Mr. Reynolds.

It was very joyful watching all these amazing actors act together, the storyline was great and the events were so unexpected, i truly enjoyed watching it and laughed so hard, I am a big dc fan but deadpool is my favorite comic charactor, and it's kinda sad reading the reviews of haters here, it's obvious that they just don't want to admit that they enjoyed it just cause they're not marvel fans, hope to see more true people writing reviews here

Look past and ignore Hollywood's glaringly obvious need to cram a certain current political alignment and agenda down your throat, such as it is these days. To the point where you might feel a hint of your gag-reflex kicking in; The movie is actually a bit entertaining

Generally, Part 2 of a movie faces real challenge to live upto the expectations set by a superb Part 1. But, DP2 is one of the movies in that league where part 2 is equally awesome! Ryan Rocks.....
