Two years ago, I was introduced to Deadpool, the most amazingly unconventional anti-hero of all time, where his ability to break the fourth-wall and deliver the crudest of jokes was finally displayed on the silver screen in an X-Men spin-off film made partly to make up for that crummy Wolverine film from 2009. And now the sequel has arisen.The story for this one is perfect for a sequel. It actually manages finds a way to develop the character of the wisecracking merc-with-a-mouth and a bit further from the last film. This story is also a lot more emotional than the previous one in the perfect way. Plus, one thing that makes the plot for this one a tad more superior to the first film is how the events are presented in a much more linear and sequential order, whereas the first film jumped around different points in time, which is one of the few little things that bothered me before.The humor is about as funny as the first film's. But the most monumental laughs result from these scenes during the credits. I can't tell you why, but these scenes made me laugh 10x as hard as the time when I first saw Drax try to master the art of invisibility by standing incredibly still.The cast is terrific. Ryan Reynolds proved in the first film that he was born for this role, and he still proves it today. He continues to perfectly portray the funniest and most bloodthirsty Marvel anti-hero ever. Josh Brolin does a good job playing the battle-hardened Cable while playing Thanos around the same time during production for this movie. The rest of the cast still carry the charm they delivered from before like T.J. Miller as Weasel, Karan Soni as Dopinder the cab driver, Leslie Uggams as Blind Al, and Brianna Hildebrand as the "moody (mutant) teen" with "the coolest name ever." I also really enjoyed Domino, played by Zazie Beetz, and how she and Deadpool are constantly bickering about her abilities. And Julian Dennison is also great as tough mutant urchin Russel/Firefist.There's not a whole lot to say about the action scenes. All I can say is that the film has action scenes that are awesome to watch, and they each find a few good jokes to mix in. In fact, the final battle has music that works great for the sake of humor. Listen very hard for any dramatic-chorus theme. Plus, speaking of music, I loved the Celine Dion song.This film is definitely the best sequel possible for Deadpool. It does everything a sequel should do, with some unique traits of its own. So in conclusion...WAKANDA FOREV...I mean...X-FORCE!!!

reviews.review_title: Very Enjoyable but not as good as the first
reviews.content: I saw this movie with the expectation it wouldn't be as good as the first and it was a correct gut feeling. I felt more anger towards the guy who killed Vanessa than anyone else in the film. I really wanted to feel the satisfaction of DP hunting him down and killing him but it didn't go that way. I felt like Cable could have been expanded on. His character starts great and the mystery makes him interesting but then he teams up with DP and jumps to the other end of the spectrum with still no real explanation of what he's about. I had zero sympathy for Firefist from start to finish. The character was really impossible to warm to and watching the film I couldn't really care less if he survived or not. I'm actually glad that the team DP creates all get killed off bar Domino because it made it humourous and after all it's not an X-Men film, we're here to watch DP. I don't really understand what Juggernaut brought to the film other than an easy tick in the box approval exercise for fans. Overall, DP was outrageously funny, some of the gags fell short, some characters could have been expanded on but the story was definitely weak compared to the first film.

The first film did more than enough to make me look forward to the sequel, even if the film itself was not as good as the promotional work ahead of it. So it is again here, as very funny adverts and promos got me excited but at the same time meant that the film didn't quite deliver in the same way. To be fair, this is because it is a two-hour film, so not easy to do the same as a few minute spot or bit. This can be seen in a few bumps along the way of the film - plot points which need to be delivered but do take the film away from joking or doing action, which is really where it works best.

reviews.review_title: Exactly what you'd expect from Ryan Reynolds
reviews.content: I may even be as bold to say it's better than the first? I had heard that it had terrible reviews before hand so braced myself. But I was delightful surprised! This movie screams Ryan Reynolds! Brilliantly dry, perfectly timed jokes, awfully brilliant one liners and pop culture references, fantastic soundtrack, excellent cast and cameos and... The legs... Oh the legs!Does not disappoint!

I'll keep it short.
Deadpool 2 is the equal to the 2016 release. As a bonus, the writers/producers/directors didn't try to clone the original, thus devaluing the property. It's funny, sad, macabre, and a joy.Get thee to the theater of your choice and enjoy.

reviews.review_title: This is a MUST SEE TWICE Movie!
reviews.content: DeadPool 2 is such a well made movie. I'll sneak in and see it again. Idk why they'd sandwich it between Avengers and Star Wars, hopefully it makes enough money for a third one. Can't explain the negative reviews, but in a world filled with easily offended, I can see how this could offend....because it is intended to and most know that walking in. There were some parts that I saw some girls in their 20's crying, even us guys were almost sweating through our eyes lol. Then hilarious. Then deep. Then sad again. But always through DeadPool's insane perspective. First movie in awhile I've wanted to see twice. Definitely a Day One Blu-ray purchase.
Really enjoyable Family movie totally worth to watch.

reviews.review_title: "Deadpool 2" Review: Pools in a Few Improvements
reviews.content: "Deadpool 2" improves upon the previous film by providing a better narrative, a worthy villain, and well-staged action scenes to go along with all of the shock meta-humor from the first entry.Wade Wilson, aka Deadpool, (Ryan Reynolds) is enjoying the life of being an immortal merc with the mouth until this lifestyle leads to the death of his girlfriend (Morena Baccarin). To redeem himself, he takes it upon himself to save a tortured mutant child named Russell, aka Firefist, (Julian Dennison) from the law and the vengeance of a time-traveling soldier named Cable (Josh Brolin).I liked the first Deadpool film well enough, but I was far from a fan of it. Everything about the Deadpool character was well handled and Ryan Reynolds was perfect casting. Not all of the humor worked with me, but most of it did. All of those same points carry over into the sequel just as equally. My major issue with the first film was the fact that if you took away all the humor being pushed into your face, the superhero story being presented was just kind of by the numbers outside of the cancer aspect. A man gets superpowers at a cost, seeks revenge, and has his girlfriend kidnapped for the final. It was fun, but there was just something about it that didn't make me love it. Perhaps the humor was too much? I tend to prefer subtlety more. Outside of that, the film had a lame villain and little to no action scenes. Luckily, number two fixes those things.The story here seems to find more serious ground than the first and made some effort to give the Deadpool character a little heart. All the humor is still there, but things do feel more balanced. That's not to say every joke landed, but most of them did. The film is still a lampoon, but that feels like an extension of the character's behavior and not at the expense of the narrative.Josh Brolin's Cable is a big assist to this. Just in appearances alone, he crushes the first film's attempt at an antagonist. A half-human, half-robot super soldier with a metal arm and multifunction gun that makes the Winter Soldier look like a wimp, even with a burnt teddy bear strapped to his belt. His character is very similar to that of a Terminator, sent back to eliminate Firefist in the past before he becomes a threat later. Actually, the whole plot is like "Terminator 2", considering the use of child and a seemingly immortal protector.An invincible hero can often be a problem since we as an audience know that there is no real danger. This can make action scenes rather pointless from a dramatic standpoint. Maybe that's why the first film didn't do much in the way of creative comic book fights (aside from the highway scene). In any case, "Deadpool 2" ups the ante by providing more superhero action this time around, and it's all done very well, thanks in large part to the new director, David Leitch. He is known best for his choreography involvement in some of the best fights in American film and co-director of "John Wick" (aka 'one of the men that killed John Wick's dog' as the credits say). The film sports some good set pieces, with the raid on a prison convey being the highlight.Outside of those three points, everything is basically the same as the last film. If you really enjoyed that one, you are likely to enjoy this one around the same level. Personally, I still think some of the humor does fall flat and tries too hard to be funny. The Deadpool films like to throw in everything and the kitchen sink, as the saying goes. (Ironically, as one of the posters LITERALLY acknowledges a kitchen sink). Either way, there is just an odd feeling when a film is constantly trying to get you to laugh at everything. I say it works at least 75% of the time. For me, a better example of a humorous superhero film was "Thor: Ragnarok" from last year. Still, to each their own. I definitely felt "Deadpool 2" was an improvement.There are plenty of post-credit scenes to wait for with great payoffs. I should note that there isn't one at the very end. So, you don't have to wait around.
This movie was all you needed in a movie, fulll action drama love ups and downs. It's a must see.

This movie is just like the previous film with humor, great action sequences, amazing character, top notch acting performance from the cast everything is on point. No extra unnecessary stuff or they didn't stretched out the film.The main villain of this film for me is definitely Cable and Josh Brolin did an amazing performance playing Cable. Just like him Ryan Reynolds as always did amazing job playing Deadpool and the other cast was also did pretty good job.There's not much to talk about the movie in depth as it's not really a superhero film but instead a parody film which makes fun of other things, cracks double meaning jokes, etc,. Etc.Overall I quiet enjoyed the movie and you should also watch it. It's not as good as the first film in my opinion but still it's Deadpool movies it'll be hilarious for sure.

reviews.review_title: Not as good as the first but still a entertainer
reviews.content: I prefer the first deadpool movie as it has the shock factor and the uniqueness of a superhero movie, it basically stands out due to its style and humour.This movie falls short on humour that is appealing. Some were funny and some forced. Through the first half it was a bit boring in parts but then picks up for the second half. It still an entertaining film and keeps true to its style and violence. Ryan Reynolds is undoubtedly funny and he is what keeps the deadpool movie alive and kicking.Special effects and actions scenes were great and the villain is laughable, I guess it suits this kind of a humourous film.

reviews.review_title: Deadpool is back with a bang!
reviews.content:
Deadpool aka Wade Wilson is back with a bang, this time with a family movie. Deadpool turns out to be another blockbuster outcoming from Marvel. Marvel always makes sure that it never misses a target. Deadpool stands out one of the best superhero films ever made. As usually Ryan Reynolds is remarkable in his Wade Wilson/Deadpool role, his comic timing, emotions, one liners, love and all makes us to fall for the character Deadpool once again. Josh Brolin is menacing and terrific in his role Cable. His screen presence is just awesome. Cable's characterization is the best one in recent times. He perfectly fits in his role and emotes every thing exceptionally. Cable's actually not a bad ass in this movie, he has a good heart which you have to watch it on screen. Julian Dennison as Firefist, the guy who Cable is looking for, he is also exceptional in his role. Zazie Beetz as Domino has got ultimate elevation scenes and she provides a very strong support to Deadpool in the proceedings. Negasonic Teenage Warhead, the longest name ever, she also got enough screen time in this movie. Colossus provides ample support to Deadpool again. The whole X-Force team found by Deadpool is just amazing and tries to stop Cable. The story of Deadpool 2 is entirely different form the first movie, Deadpool. There are too many characters in this film. Right from the word go, the movie is both engaging and funny. You shouldn't dare to miss the epic titles rolling. The first 10 minutes of the movie surprises you and brings an exclamatory mark on our faces. All the action sequences were extraordinary, same as in Deadpool. Dialogues were hilarious and mocks DC franchise mostly. There are too many Marvel, DC and other references in this movie. The best one is "I'm Batman". Comparing Deadpool 2 with Deadpool, I can say Deadpool is the best and favorite for most of the people. Deadpool is more funny than Deadpool 2, but makes your bones tickle in this one too. I was too late to mention our favorite character, Dopinder, he actually kills the bad guy(Spoiler alert). The post credits scenes of Deadpool 2 are the best ever from Marvel franchise. Flash is not only the one who changes timelines(Spoiler alert no.2). The biggest surprise is the Wolverine(Spoiler alert no.3). Finally, Deadpool kills Ryan Reynols aka Green Lantern(Spoiler alert no.4).
Final word- Don't miss Deadpool 2!

If I remember right the first Deadpool was "ok" and mostly funny. But damn, this one was just hard to watch. There were a few laughs but that's not enough if everything is supposed to be funny. Actually the most funny part was that deadpool always pointed out the lazy writing, because that is so true. Otherwise his comments to the audience are just annoying. It's such a boring Film, i couldn't watch it till the end. He can't die, well that makes everything pointless and crushes any tension... Nearly everyone is dying. So why should i care?! Plus People dying over and over again is not funny, at least in my world.
And what comes on top, he knows he is inside a movie, turnes everything Into something silly, meaningless and boring!
OVERRATED!!!

Wouldn't normally write a review but when I see people giving it 1 or 2 stars I thought I need to step in. The humour is obviously way above the intelligence of the people who give low ratings, I've watched this 6 times and still piss myself laughing, yes it's more of the same from Deadpool 1 but is that a bad thing, if it works why change it, I'm not going to put spoilers for anyone that hasn't seen it, just need to know that if you actually understand every joke then you'll laugh uncontrollably from beginning to end, the reviews saying it's rubbish are from people wanting a superhero movie, this breaks the rules, it's not Superman it's a hilarious comedy that just happens to have a man in a costume that can do the impossible, I'm not a geeky kid wanting a superhero, I just love a good comedy and there hasn't been one offering since the first Deadpool, this is the most hilarious film you'll see for a good while, get it watched and enjoy

I know it is hard to believe in this era of liberal (message) movies and tv but this one was actually enjoyable. A little liberalism but done well in a away that we can all laugh at ourselves, like in the good old common sense, politically incorrect days when it was great to be alive and we all worked together to build a better nation. Where did we diverge from the path? Watch this one if you want a break from the insanity that threatens to consume our world.
This 2nd Deadpool is just as funny and as vulgar as the first one but may bring tears to your eyes.

A good follow up film but with very poor CGI really detracts from the humour and action that would otherwise be great.A worthy watch but don't watch in HD or 4k and you'll be fine with the special effects.
A Wonderful movie.Lots of fun...action was awesome...story was not bad

Better story line. 
Amazing action. 
Fresh laughs. 
True to the original.A truly epic sequel!!

Thanks marvel for making this a family film..Awesome as it was before..yes it's not better form the first one but in 2018 it is the best. Best action + comedy film. new characters in. & I love is when it talks about other films in the movie. & want its other part to come soon..

Deadpool 2 was definitely the sequel I wanted it to be. The first film was a love story. But this was about family. This has such a great message just like The LEGO Movie had a great message to each and every one of us. Check out Deadpool 2 if you haven't. Five out of five.

Deadpool 2 is the sequel to the not very well known indie film Deadpool, and it's pretty much on the same level as the first. For every thing this movie does better, it also does something worse than the original. The action, story, and music are better. But the humor, editing, and overall impact was less. It's just more of the same. So if you like Deadpool, go see it.

No second parties were good, but Deadpool2 is the exception that confirms the rule. After The Empire Strikes Back, of course. It's a cool, very funny, very well made film widely bill. The cast is luxurious, the story is simple, but perfect. The sound and the effects go for an Oscar. Totally recomdable if you want to have a good time. Side note is the cast, Josh Brolin, T.J. Miller, Julian Dennison are spectacular.

Deadpool 2 is tedious and a failure to brake the forth-wall.Late in the hodgepodge that is Deadpool 2, the superhero joke-machine confronts the muscular, time-traveling villain, Cable, who's trying to murder an adolescent mutant. Deadpool yells, "Hands off that kid, John Connor!" and part of the audience laughs and part of it stares dumbly, trying to process the movie's 674th pop-culture reference. But what's the joke, exactly? John Connor wasn't the time-traveling killer. He was the kid who the time-traveling Terminator was trying to kill - except (I think) in the last sequel, which no one even remembers, when he was trying to kill ... his own mother??? Himself??? It's not worth the time it takes to process. The basic joke, repeated ad infinitum, is that that Deadpool has seen the Terminator films, along with the Marvel and DC and Star Wars movies. He's like an especially obnoxious fanboy except you could punch a fanboy and he'd shut up. Deadpool takes a licking and keeps on sticking. We've reached superhero saturation point, and Deadpool 2 is less a satire of that condition than a symptom of it. It has zero suspense - it's too hip, too meta, for suspense. The action is brutally edited and mostly undistinguished - a surprise, given that the stuntman turned director, David Leitch, devised amazing, close-in, faux-single-shot fights in his last film, Atomic Blonde. But he's out of his element with such pro forma CGI, which not even Deadpool's CGI jokes can redeem. Although this is primarily a comedy (with gore), Leitch doesn't hang back and let the actors develop a rhythm, the way Taika Waititi did in the Hope-and-Crosby-like Thor: Ragnarok. He just whomps away. But dull-witted direction wouldn't matter if the script (credited to Rhett Reese, Paul Wernick, and Reynolds) were more consistent. In my (favorable) review of the first Deadpool, I estimated that 50 percent of jokes hit home, another 30 whizzed by inoffensively, and only 20 percent were real stinkers. In Deadpool 2, the percentages are reversed. A small number of the gags land, among them a riotously tasteless parachute assault by an ad hoc team of second-tier superheroes. And I can never get enough digs - however limp - at the idea that all superhero mothers are named Martha. But there are so many wincers for so ramshackle a plot. The thrust of Deadpool 2 is that Deadpool, having suffered a personal tragedy, kinda sorta wants to be an X-Man but keeps screwing up on account of how selfish he is - until he meets an extremely unappealing mutant kid, Russell, and finally thinks of someone other than himself. His chief antagonist appears to be Cable, whom Brolin plays more or less straight and somehow invests with dignity and pathos - making this an unprecedented twofer in the morose supervillain sweepstakes. Zazie Beetz shows great poise as a fun new character called Domino, whose superpower is luck, and wittier filmmakers would have concocted lots of Rube Goldberg disasters around her. (What's there is decent enough to make you see what might have been.) But there's nothing much to be done with the Boris Badenov special effect known as Colossus, whose face is dully frozen. To offset the happy fact that there's a gay superhero, the writers bring back the babbling Indian cab driver, Dopinder, who in light of the recent Hank Azaria Apu hoo-hah goes over about as well as Jar Jar Binks. Deadpool makes a crack elsewhere about "cultural appropriation," but he's silent on the dopey Dopinder stereotype. I suppose you could make a case for Deadpool 2 the way people do for Joe Dante's ramshackle sequel Gremlins 2: The New Batch - a spirited goof on Gremlins - and, further back, Warner cartoon alum Frank Tashlin's antic Son of Paleface, in which Bob Hope shared the screen with Roy Rogers and Trigger. A superhero movie with the looseness of a Mad magazine parody remains a viable idea, as demonstrated by the underrated Mystery Men and, of course, Deadpool. But a film that spits one-liners as mechanically as a tennis-ball launcher is even more tediously predictable than one with no sense of humor at all. Incidentally, Deadpool, a 20th Century Fox release, opens with Reynolds exhaling a cloud of cigarette smoke into the camera, probably meant to tweak his superhero cousins at Disney, which doesn't permit smoking in its movies. Disney, of course, is on the brink of acquiring Fox's entertainment division, which will make it even more of a franchise-oriented juggernaut than it already is. Although that's an alarming prospect, I'm all for purging cigarettes from movies and TV, which statistics show have an undue influence in getting kids to start smoking. If the filmmakers were as self-reflexive as they pretend to be, they'd find a way to show that Deadpool's insides are becoming as charred as his face. In any case, he should enjoy his cigarettes while he can.

Ryan Reynolds is perfect as Deadpool. The wit and cheekiness in this movie is a perfect escape to everyday life. This is a pure, park your brain at the door and enjoy movie. If you are easily offended, this isn't the movie for you. If you are sick of living in a PC world, then this is a perfect movie for you. Deadpool is rude, sarcastic and completely bonkers!

reviews.review_title: Not as good as the 1st one
reviews.content: I have to agree with Kuturak's review here, although I'll be more generous and give it a 6. The 1st one was really hard to beat. I had high expectations on this one due to the high rating here at IMDB, but it didn't live up to it.It had it's good moments, but there were long stretches that just weren't good. Maybe I should watch the cut version and not the Uncut one ...

More jokes than I expected. About time marvel decide to make more marvel related jokes since it's their movie. One Disney jokes which is amazing since Disney owns marvel but I'm not gonna tell you, you're going to have to watch it yourself to find out. Great amount of violent. Great amount of Slo-Mo. Great amount of Extreme CGI. Great amount of laughs. And great amount of sh*t talk.SMALL SPOILER:
I would of rate this 10/10 but Stan Lee wasn't in it. :( sorry

Finally watching the sequel of Deadpool and it's worth the wait. Deadpool never let me down, I had my expectation high since the release of the trailer and it didn't let me down. I have mixed emotion watching this movie. A lot of lines from various movies were being said by Deadpool in this movies, it's hilarious. The fact that Josh Brolin played as Cable in this making it much more hilarious for those who had watched IW. Even though it content many bad jokes and obvious ending, Deadpool never let me down.

Unexpected deaths, one liners, Brolin and Reynolds and the big lad at the end. 
Worth the £25 with nachos price tag.

reviews.review_title: I rated it 7 because deaplool & Ryan Reynolds are both favourites.
reviews.content: Good funny parts, but not as great as the first one. Hope the next one has a better story to run with. The story seemed pretty mediocre and dragged.

reviews.review_title: Still good, not as good as the first
reviews.content: The first Deadpool, aside from being funny, was a well deserved spin on the superhero genre. So I was excited to see where this movie would take the character. And while it still is gleefully funny and raunchy, it is not quite as good as the first movie. And I think it's because the script this time around was weaker than the first. While it is true that the script never really subverted a lot of the superhero genre as it does blatantly copy all the cliches without much of the clever subversion the movie claimed, I felt that the movie was charming enough to really look pass the glaring issues with the first movie's script. This time around the story was just so much weaker than before, being written around a kid who is just not very good in this movie sadly, although that's because of the poor material he works with, as the character Russell is just not very likable or funny, outside of getting his ass kicked a few times which was funny (child abuse is bad regardless, but still it was funny). And it is in general weird that Deadpool would actually care about this character. It never felt like something he would do, although I am going to give the benefit of the doubt and say that it is true for him in the comics. The action, while not terrible, just felt kind of lazy and uninspired. Which is a shame considering director David Leitch's work on the first John Wick film. The only time I can ever say I felt any thrill was the fight on the prison transport. But other than that it's just by the numbers.A big surprise was that the jokes and gags that callback to the first film wasn't the biggest problem with the film. Sure they do feel stale and a little lazy (although some callbacks are still funny), but for the most part I was still laughing and having a great time. Sure the constant sex jokes and pop culture references do get old, but the movie still does have a ton of wit to make the movie thoroughly funny regardless of duds that are in the film, largely thanks to Ryan Reynolds being perfect for Deadpool. Cable and Domino do make great editions to the film, as are the return of Colossus and Negasonic Teenage Warhead (who doesn't get a lot of good lines in this movie like she did in the first film). The visuals and production are also a step up from the first film too, and also the intro is one of the funnest I've seen in a long time, although probably not as funny as the first film. Plus an absolutely brilliant post-credit scene.It might not live up to the first Deadpool film, but it still is a fun ride regardless. Although I am rather worried that the third film will suck considering the trajectory of trilogies, plus the much weaker writing overall.
This is fun, clever action. -You can't have too much of that!

reviews.review_title: Hide your kids hide your wifes
reviews.content: Not the family movie you expect. But that's the point. Deadpool does it again.

reviews.review_title: An improvement on its fabulous predecessor
reviews.content: I went to the theater without much expectations. Because I believed that the first movie worked because of its novelty and there is nothing remaining for a second outing. But, I ended up enjoying Deadpool 2 much more than the first one. To begin with, the increased budget showed and the resultant improvement in CGI was really good. While the first movie just depended on its lead's sense of humor and a few action set pieces, the second movie felt more holistic in its emotions. It was pleasing to see that. The story as a whole was more rounded than that of the first movie.But, there were areas that I felt needed more attention. A major one is character development. There where a lot more characters introduced, but barely developed. What was worse what what they did with the characters from the first movie. Blind Al barely had any screen-time and was not at all developed. I felt particularly sad about the way they worked Negasonic Teenage Warhead. The character was brilliant and one of my favorites from the first movie. But, she is completely sidelined in this one. Colossus had a meatier role though.Overall, it's a rather enjoyable movie. Feels a bit like a set up for X-Force, but still stands on its own. Most importantly, it has the best mid-credit scenes I have ever seen.

reviews.review_title: Do Not See This Unless U're A True Cinephile !!
reviews.content: Deadpool 2 for me is somehow better than its predescessor. But one thing for sure was that the jokes referred so much to many superheroes movies and other genre across the years (even Basic Instinct legendary scene). If ure not really a cinephile., thhe jokes might left u dry, but if you are., then its the best R-Rated action comedy by far,., leave ur brain at home when u see this movie.,but dont get me wrong.. this movie is genius!!! A f***in must see !!!
But the Super Duper Cut is as close to perfection we will ever see in a movie.
If you want to laugh and like action then this movie is for you. I love it.

Just as the first one, Deadpool 2 didn't disappoint. It's a crazy movie that breaks the fourth wall and makes jokes of every single detail. It's an awesome chance to go and have a good laugh and for the best experience I suggest going to the cinema instead of waiting for the Blu-ray. The strong language in DP makes it all the more fun as it gives an idea of what the character is without restrictions. DP is definitely the craziest character in the Marvel universe and is real fun to watch. This movie gets emotional at times but that doesn't keep DP from mocking things and making jokes. X-Force is a great addition to the movie. Unlike the first movie DP2 actually has a well thought out plot. One thing leads to another. Loved the story. It's a must watch movie....
Love the humor, love the actors, love the writing. Such a great film.Deadpool 3, anybody?

In this sequel, Deadpool must deal with his enemies, the love of his life being in danger and the strange partnership of a man coming from the future and a mutant kid. There are no words to describe just how clever the humor in this movie is. The first Deadpool movie was groundbreaking and, surprisingly, the level of this one is even higher. I'm amazed at how the writers can so easily insert humor in action/serious scenes without breaking the tension and how, even scenes that are heartbreaking, fit so well with the continuity of the movie. But there's more than just humor. The characters are amazingly developed, each one of them drawing you in with their different personalities. It also has great character development for Deadpool, something that we couldn't really see in the first movie since it worked as a presentation for the character. Still, it's just heartwarming to see that, even when he's a mercenary, he still has morals that he lives by. The combination of Deadpool and the mutant kid is adorable, and Cable and Domino steal all of their scenes with how good they are. The best team!Absolutely loved it!

Deadpool, a man with a special power that can recover his body from any damage, team up together with some mutant squad to protect a young boy with special ability from a savage, time-traveler cyborg.
This is the second movie of Deadpool that has been released by Marvel. The visual is top-notch since it is a blockbuster movie that gets a large amount of budget. It is an action-comedy movie that carries some dramatic tension at about the end of the story.Deadpool is one of not many movies that break the traditional rules of making a film by allowing the main character recognizes that he is being watched by the audience, which is not a surprising thing because the movie is just an adaptation of an existing Marvel comic series. We can expect this kind of characteristic.Since this movie breaks a common rule of a traditional movie, we can see a lot of chaotic going on in a funny way. We can have fun even the scene and are unreasonable. Apart from lame genital jokes, violence, and gore, Deadpool 2's plot can be considered as one of the good "family" movies. (I am serious, really)

I am a huge marvel fan and movie fan in general let's put it this way. I was expecting more. I didn't see the film at the cinemas i waited to see the Home release since there where also quite a few movies which i prioritised over DP2 at the Cinemas, i waited and waited my anticipation was getting higher and higher... i finally watched the movie and it was just ... fine. Nothing special unlike the first, the sequel felt rushed and lack luster, i enjoyed the cast and some of the jokes but no where near as much as the 2016 Comic Adaptation.

This movie is absolutely brilliant, a lot more action than the first, same dark/silly humour and soul as the first. I was worried this would be a bad movie because the first one was something original and i feared the second part wouldnt be able to replicate the success and originality. And i was wrong there. I dont believe all the negative reviews on this site though, just disregard them and believe the ratings and positive reviews you see everywhere, 8/10 on IMDB and 83% on rotten tomatoes arent lying. All in all, If you liked the first one you will like this one for sure, if you didnt like the first one then i doubt you will like this one.

Despite being fun and inventive, this is a sequel that dives crotch-first into a moral quandary. It also suffers from a lot of the same problems many other sequels have: re-hash. Moving from one plot point to another, it repeats the creative strategy from the first film. Yet still, it is an enjoyable second entry into the "not really a superhero" superhero genre.

reviews.review_title: Tiring tropes and stereotypes hidden behind clever humor trying to convince us this movie is different than others, but it really isn't, we've seen this topics over and over
reviews.content: I have a hard time figuring out some of the plot lines, were they ironic and trying to make a point or this movie also falls under the so predictable tropes of man pain, fridging female characters to give man pain, the love will save you theme, the woman as a price, the guy always have to be a hero while the woman stays at home waiting for him while he is a hero, the man with the killed wife and child that stops caring for them ones they are safe, because being a hero is more important, the female bad ass that has nothing more in the movie than being just incredibly bad ass and drops no blood, the lesbian teenage couple that have no story line but are their for representation and are presented as the biggest stereotype of a tomboy with no emotions and giggly femme. And the whole adopted family theme, really. It was so hypocritical to talk about family when the movie destroyed the families at hand just to give make us believe that some dysfunctional people make a family, as if this ever happens in real life. Why is the movie industry so obsessed with family themes, that everybody should belong to a family. Every second movie and tv show these days is about that.

This is the first time I write a review although I've been rating movies on here for years! But, man! This movie! I could not pass this one without saying something because those were the best 2 hours in a very long time!!! I haven't had this much fun in ages!
All the references? Always the best! I was afraid it wasn't gonna be as good as the first one (you know, sequels!) BUT it exceeded my expectations, and boy! was it good! DO NOT MISS THE POST CREDIT SCENES THEY ARE HILARIOUS! "
I'm definitely gonna be watching this one again! Just amazing!
This must have been the greatest Marvel Movie so far, full of wit and laughter, superb music choices and breathtaking action, all the ingredients of a great night out at the Movies

reviews.review_title: The jokes and violence is more brutal, the third act fails.
reviews.content: Deadpool 2 kicks more ass and are even more crazy than the first one. I still hold the first one as slightly better. DP 2's first act is the best in the movie. The jokes are hilarious, the action is raw and awesome and it is also surprisingly emotional. Deadpool is so one of a kind of a series. It breaks the fourth wall so many times, Deadpool jokes with X-Men actors, movies and cultural references. Unfourtanetely it drops in quality especially in the last act. The humour can be described like some of the lines, «Was that realt necessary?» and «That's disturbing». Deadpool jokes with «that's lazy writing» is funny but does not cover up the fast that it is lazy writing in some parts. Also the scenes where deadpool dies multiple times became just annoying and his quarrels with Cable made me check my watch, it felt dragged out. Still the movie is entertaining and I still give it a high score because of the first 30-40 minutes. Cable is a slightly better villain than Ajax, and I really like how he looks (although Deadpool harass with him ofc). The end credits follow up how insane deadpool is, when Deadpool shoots Ryan Reynolds in the head while reading the script of Green Lantern and also shoots his character in the Wolverine. I'm wondering how they're gonna follow up the next movies. Deadpool is a character who I feel don't have to have many movies because his character is just so crazy that people will eventually be tired of him. Still I enjoy the deadpool movies, it's just funny see a superhero movie where they are so little self righteous about their superheros like superhero movies usually are. Deadpool have no limits when it comes to blood, violence and insulting literally everyone. That is a plus in my book, in these days when we can't joke about anything.
This movie was great, lot's of action, full of humor and spot on. I just love it.

I really wish the golden arches of McDonald's weren't looming just across the road from the Cineworld in Brighton. Very tempting. Not healthy. Very tasty though.Deadpool 2 is pretty tasty too.It starts pretty much in the same vein and with a similar feel as its predecessor which in my humble, is both good and bad. Well, not really bad, but being R-rated, with swearing, people being turned into shish kebabs and breakings of the 4th wall and meta references, the first Deadpool movie was a very original breath of fresh air to the huge superhero genre.Especially with all that DC crap trying to challenging and ultimately failing to rival Marvel Studios' success.So sadly, we can't have that same breath of fresh air in the sequel but for me, the latter part of the movie really picks things up. There's one part in particular that takes a similar scene from the original but makes it way more hilarious. And from that point, we are properly off and running.We are also treated to some nice surprises, bits of character development and story arcs therein and a surprise Marvel fan favourite villain that is foreshadowed for much of the movie.A character, like Deadpool himself, who was done a grave injustice in a previous X-Men universe movie, but who gets an excellent redemption in this movie and I'm sure we will be getting to see more of them in the third outing which I am sure is very much on the table.Deadpool 2 is still laugh out loud funny with a great story and superb addition to the franchise.
To be hones i dont like deadpool 1 but this movie is great, it have everything i expect from deadpool: funny, action, breaking the 4 wall,... Great firm

reviews.review_title: not better then first one but still good
reviews.content: This sequel to the first deadpool movie once again ryan reynolds plays deadpool and in this one deadpool has to protect a kid from josh brolin as cable this movie has alot of action and its very funny

reviews.review_title: An Incredibly Enjoyable Sequel That Really Delivers
reviews.content: I had high hopes going into this film, but also some worries that they'd make Deadpool too much of what he is. But they really impressed me with what they made. Deadpool 2 does everything the first did, and a little more. Despite what I've heard other people say about the choice of killing of Vanessa at the beginning of the movie, I actually thought it was a great plot element/motivation that didn't feel set up or forced in any way. Although, an issue I have with the aftermath of this, is that I feel like Wade, emotionally, gets over it too quickly. Fortunately, this does lead into some really mesmerizing and beautiful scenes of Wade communicating with Vanessa in the afterlife (it may have been consciously). It's also nice to see them take a real focus on Wade's personal life, which transitions into the main plot of the movie.Wade has to protect a Mutant teenager named Russell, of which Wade feels sympathy for since the headmaster of the building Russell is held at tortures/abuses him. This also makes Wade reflect on his past with his own father who wasn't such a great father figure for him. However, Wade and Russell are arrested and are put devices around their necks which doesn't allow them to use their powers/mutations. We see a different side of Wade in the prison as he is no longer sympothizing with Russell, but rather relenting him since he gets Wade in trouble and severely hurt by other inmates. The relationship between thee two characters constantly change throughout the film, but make sense since Russell is only 15-16 and has still not fully matured. I liked the prison sequences and thought they worked well on developing the eventual change on which side Russell chooses to take, which is going against Wade and wanting to kill the headmaster. Overall, I wasn't a big fan of Russell in the movie really at all, but he was given enough character development that I gave at least a couple cares in the world about him.When Cable enters the picture, it takes the film to a WHOLE new level story wise. Cable's come from the future to kill Russell because in the future, Russell kills Cable's wife and daughter. I do feel that Cable was a bit underdeveloped and I felt myself really wanting to see more of him the film, but it *is* a DEADPOOL movie, and they're saving that for the eventual 'X-Force' film that's supposed to be coming out. Never the less, the time when Cable *is* in the movie, he is completely badass and did feel properly used. And this leads into the best sequence of the movie, the car chase. The scene is really well-choreographed/directed, and this goes for nearly all the other action scenes in the entire movie. And I wouldn't expect any less from the John Wick director. The Kill Bill-like scenes in the beginning with Deadpool slicing people's limbs off especially felt like the John Wick style. Cable is really awesome in this sequence and it's so cool to see him in this movie in general.The chemistry between Zazie Beetz (Domino) and Ryan Reynolds is really great and I wish we saw more of her as well. But again, they'll probably explore her character more later. She stole a lot of the scenes she was in and fought off her enemies almost effortlessly. This sequence of Deadpool forming his team also includes one of my favorite jokes, while talking about Josh Brolin/Cable, "He's short! 5'11"! Not like in the comics!". And of course Peter, who saw the ad, and thought it looked fun. And then they kill of the whole team (excluding Domino and Deadpool). Yep. They just all die while jumping out of a plane with parachutes. That was absolutely hilarious! The ending is I guess a bit cliche-ish, but still a good moment between the characters.The comedy, as expected, was really, REALLY funny and landed almost every time. The opening and end credits scenes are what really made me almost choke on my food . Deadpool going back in time after given a time traveling mechanism and killing the terrible 2009 version of Deadpool from X-Men Origins: Wolverine and also killing the real life Ryan Reynolds version of himself about to read the 'Green Lantern' script were ingenious and made me laugh so hard.Also, a cool little tidbit they put in there was as the X-Force were jumping out of the helicopter, everyone unintentionally formed an 'X' when everyone's bodies lines up. That was a nice little detail.But overall, I do personally think this is better than it's predecessor and worth seeing twice in the theater.RATING: 8.8/10

reviews.review_title: Bang for the buck? More like fifty cents
reviews.content: Didn't find this to be as laughable or enjoyable as the first Dead Pool. Schtick was lame, premise was lame. Acting was just okay. As with the first movie, continuity was screwed uo, but that was part of the story line,

I really enjoyed the first Deadpool flick and gave it an 8/10 after two viewings of it. The action was great and the tongue in cheek humor really helped to make it stand out. I have always been fascinated with metafiction and its application in comics and had been writing one myself so when Deadpool came out I was hooked on that style of humor. Alan Moore also toyed with the meta in a lot of his work (Watchmen, Promethea, League of Extraordinary Gentlemen). The style just fit.What I'm about to say is really contradictory... but Deadpool 2 relies too much on the style of the first and it's strengths to hook me in enough to care. Cool visuals, great action/gore and hilarious yet cheap metafictional pops aside, this sequel is far from perfect in many ways.Spoilers from here on out -- if you haven't seen it jump to the end of this review to see the final score.
Ryan Reynolds snark is on point when it needs to be, but any attempt at seriousness (the death of Vanessa - DP's girlfriend) falls flat. The X-force (Deadpools team of discount-store mutants) felt rushed together and the characters like Cable and Domino (no relation to the kick-ass Keira Knightly flick from 2005) had little to no backstory presented. It felt pretty obvious that a Cable or X-force movie may be in the works, and that's the biggest takeaway of importance I left the theatre with. While an X-Force movie has been cited as "in the works", the cast is still up the air as half of the team didn't make it out of Deadpool 2 alive.Cable never felt like a threat due to his short and lackluster introduction and backstory, I'm not sure if Yukio ever showcased her abilities (turns out she did, and it was so fast I missed it in my first viewing), and the casting of Terry Crews and cameo of Ben Affleck (as well as the short-lived feature of Shatterstar) felt like such a waste. I grew to appreciate Domino's "luck" ability by the end and appreciated the cinematography used in the scenes where we saw her power at work. Russell "Firefist" was also one of the shining parts of the film, as Julian Denison (Hunt For the Wilderpeople) did a great job portraying the hurt and angst his character endured at the hands of those who tortured him.While the two new characters of Domino and Firefist hit their strides, the rest of the supporting characters fell flat with a lack of direction. The action was great, but the writing was not there to get me to actually care about the characters or what may happen in the next film. I'm hoping Deadpool 3 or X-Force can put some actual emotional connection and appeal into Wade Wilson again, as the Merc with a mouth has great cinematic potential still to be tapped and there is still time to right the ship. This can be so much more than a cheap-superhero cash in...
TLDR: Action, fun, and laughs are here. Substance, a story with consequences, characters you actually care about? Not so much. Maybe I was expecting more because my last superhero experience was the impeccable Black Panther, but Deadpool 2 didn't quite get the job done for me.
Deadpool 2 - 6.5/10
Do you agree? Are we big idiots? What should we review next? Let us know in the comments or share this on social media with your friends!Till next time!
Talkies and Jabberwocky

Deadpool 2 a really good sequel to the first Deadpool which was release back in 2016. Thanks to who ever release the test footage of Deadpool. 
The movie starts from where it left of, with bigger budget, more explosions, amazing choreographed actions and bigger cast compare to the first Deadpool. Without giving too much away from this movie here are my good points and bad points for this movie: The Good Points:
This movie has a great plot which gives you some heart moment feels,dialogues that will make you laugh, and great cast choice. Cable and Domino are two new characters that shines in the movie, when they are on screen you will enjoy their performance and make you hunger more of them in the movie.Dopinder have more role this time which is a great thing his scenes with deadpool are to look for in the this movie. Ryan Reynolds is the only person who can play deadpool, his performance for this movie was amazing. The movie also have ton of movie reference, compare to the first movie, you love the jokes made with the reference.The Bad Points:
The main flaw in this movie is that even though the plot s good, you can feel some part of the movie to be a bit draggy and some jokes that fails to hit with the audience. It's sad to see the previous cast that made the first movie a success had only a few scenes. I was looking forward to see more of negasonic teenage warhead, colossus, Blind Al, and weasel. Hope we can see more these roles in the future movies to come. Should you watch this movie:
To be honest, it's a good movie as a whole and you wouldn't be disappointed with this movie. Even if you have not watch the first movie or if you hate the first one, you might like this movie.It's a family movie for 18 and above. Hope we get to see more of these roles in the future again.

I loved Deadpool 2, it didn't feel as focused as the first one but the jokes came at you hard and fast. One the best movies to come out this year. Lots of references to pop-culture so keep your eyes peeled. Great movie, but don't expect to see a traditional super hero movie that takes itself seriously, definitely the merc with a mouth who takes his work seriously but doesn't take himself seriously.

I went in thinking this was going to be maybe as good or not as good as the first. For me it was better!Silly little scenes here and there that make me cringe but the action was there, the mickey take on stereotype super hero movies was there, the things that made the first Deadpool movie worked was taken to a whole new level.

Without spoiling anything I just love elements of this movie where the music even joins in on the fight between Deadpool and Cable when they argued over music.I am buying this on DVD when it comes out and I want there to be a Deadpool 3!

reviews.review_title: Wade Wilson, the not-so wise-as$, nut-cracking merc anymore
reviews.content: There is one line in the movie that summarizes everything: "Well, that's just lazy writing." - Wade Wilson AKA The friendly, red-spandex-wearing, neighborhood mercenary.There's a lot of expectations we, as audience members, would carry while walking into the theaters to watch this movie. For example, the first movie was a successful parody of the superhero origin movies, and it nailed that particular aspect beautifully. This feels like the painful sequels that FOX is generally known for. I have a feeling that Ryan knew what he was getting into with this movie, given the multiple quips about it being a "family-movie". For the majority of the run-time, we were treated to the equivalent of a Woody Allen movie explaining the innocence of Winnie the Pooh.There are four characters in the entire movie (Deadpool, Domino, Cable and Russell). Everything else is just a glorified cameo, from Morena Baccarin as the Ghost of Girlfriend Dead to Alan Tudyk as a redneck.We can't walk into this movie expecting it to have its characters make a ton of logical decisions, but what we can expect is to watch Deadpool mind-numbingly break the fourth wall. I agree that it is amazing and we all wish we were Deadpool (Radioactive Shar Pei bite included).The one thing we would take away from this movie is that they basically invalidated the entire movie in the end. As a Doctor Who/Back To The Future/Flashpoint/Harry Potter(?) fan, I understand the issue with paradoxes. But, DP basically sticks where it shouldn't be by killing himself and himself (seriously, you have to watch the movie to get that). If you're a comic-book reader (or lover), you will love the fact that they've finally done Juggernaut justice. It doesn't even sound like Ryan Reynolds. Cable and Domino were absolutely beautiful, and we need to see them in another movie and soon. Hopefully, by then, Wade would've seen the actual Star Wars (I wonder which version he did watch though). I, for one, left the theater chuckling at the many, many easter eggs peppered throughout the movie, including the Logan death (oops, spoilers) theme and the clearly James Bond-inspired opening credits.P.S. How long will it be before they write off the stereotypical, Indian taxi-driver? Come on, Ryan, that bit's evident. Maybe sit with Stan or Rob and come up with an Indian superhero (who doesn't s*ck)?

reviews.review_title: It is good, but not as the first one.
reviews.content: I don't understand why people woud like that one better than the first one (except if you're a complete fanboy). Everything is less except what's make a movie superficial (cg, cg, cg for no reason, long empty action scenes, etc.). The plot is weak, the dialogues are often comonplace and easy, the fights are ok, but the CG just sucks, we can see it too easily and it just seems fake (too much I mean). It is still a good movie, I would give it 7.2 while I would give 8.5 to the first one. I'm just sad that all this extra money pumped into this does not serve it at all... It's ok, it's not a complete crap, but it's clearly a partial deception to me.

I watch this movie many times, every time happy :)
I like it very much. The movie has a lot of humorous scenes, fun :))Thanks IMDB!!!!

Wasn't worth all the hype.
Its a good movie but the jokes get sort of boring after a time. 
Some of them seem forced. There is no strong story-line. Both Ryan Reynolds and Josh Brolin nail their roles ... but there's just no meat in the story-line (which is too narrow with nothing big really happening except a kid who'll possibly become a whacko in the future being hunted down).The two post credit scenes are giggle-worthy.

Went in expecting some formulaic story, but in turn, was pleasantly surprise with where the plot went. As twisted and warped as Deadpool is, and not too sound cheesy, he has a heart. This movie was entertaining, fun, wacky, and left you feeling satisfied. 10 our of 10 stars from me.

reviews.review_title: Super cool and funny as heck!
reviews.content: Saw "Deadpool 2" a few days ago! I must say that Wade Wilson AKA Deadpool is one hilarious cool cat who goes the extra mile to intice your funny bone. He comes off across as meandering with relentless pursuit for the inevitable. The cool thing about this movie is the homely way in which it was crafted, with endless line after line of comedic hilarity. The short-lived romanticism between Wade and Vanessa left Wade auspicious to favorability in many ways I come to see. Cable was one badass time travelling cybernetic mutant soldier with hardy moves and albeit relationally succumbing in character with his would-be allies. Russell possessed this haunting StephenKing-esqe sort of character about him of the likes of a demonized problem child immersed into witchcraft occultism, the kid was marvelously persuading indeed. Needless to say the comedic intent of the film in plain light is witnessed amongst its cool as fsck action and special effects one would come to expect these days, Hollywood has truly come a long way in producing outrageous real-as-life technicality in the stunt department I must admit. Wilson's team of ensembled mutants was refreshingly well selected with each member appropriating their own distinctly unique gimmick and comedic force into the act. Domino was one female on the team which seemed to stand out in the action and beauty department, she was hot as fsck with a sort of catlike strut about her, she was awesome. The plot and overall progressive nature of the story left nothing to be undesired in the popcorn movie department; There was especially this air of mysticism and infiltrative allure in the way the drama was shot and its action scenes executed. This film was one super fun ride fo sho!

I haven't seen such a good movie in the past few months. I didn't expect a nothing special, just a classic deadpool with a lot of cool bloody scenes and funny quotes. In fact, that's what i got but on a higher level.I'd like to bring up especially the beggining of the movie, as a whole movie, this, not as the other kinda cliché movies where you can be really predictable, invocated in me that it is going to be really good. What I'm talking about are things, that are happening suddenly without useless backgrounding and slow progress. The movie has been packed with a lot of action like this, added with a great humour which left me laughing on a lot of scenes. Mixed with a sad moments which in conclusion were de facto funny, some heart taking scenes and things what every movie, supposed to keep you in tension, should have.Cinematical level, which i classify as a quality of scenes and music, was also good. I have nothing to say to the music choice, every music fitted the emotions in the scene and helped you to fit´feel´ in it, too.My final ´let's say subjective´ rating is that movie wasn't boring, there was a few scenes with my thoughts somewhere else, however it was minimum times and let's not count it. Numbers are 9/10, recommending as a comedy, either romantic, dark or whatever you'll consider it as. Watched in cinema.

Deadpool 2 delivers well enough to be a worthy successor to the first Deadpool movie.Starting with everything I loved about this film: the jokes are on point. I'm was cracking up a lot. The action was amazing! All the cool stunts and fight scenes were Kingsman-level amazing! And finally, the ending was phenomenal. To see Deadpool erasing terrible events in the past such as killing off the horribly-made Deadpool mess in X-Men Origins: Wolverine or killing off "Ryan Reynolds" before he signed on to do Green Lantern was everything to me.It looks like I love Deadpool 2 a lot, but no movie is perfect however.First off, I felt like Vanessa's death in the beginning was so dramatic and intense that it distracted me from the movie. I wanted to have fun with the comedy in this movie, but I just couldn't stop thinking about Vanessa.And secondly, I wasn't expecting the supposed X-Force team from the helicopter to die off that fast. Like whoa! Honestly, I didn't like that part. I had high expectations of an X-Force team to possibly form for a potential X-Force movie, but no it didn't happen. And knowing that some of those characters are from the Marvel comics, those hired superhero's had potential to be part of the action and have their own moments in the story. If the writers wanted to make a scene with superheroes falling to their deaths, it would've been wise to create characters not originally from the comics and let them be amateur heroes who fall into an insane death-spree.But other than that, it's a good movie.

reviews.review_title: Very Funny but not as good as the first.
reviews.content: This movies was very funny as I laughed throughout the entire thing. The over the top honor made this one of the most enjoyable and entertaining movies of the year. Josh Brolin killed it as cable in this movie. Ryan Reynolds is very good as well. Overall this movie was very good but I did not enjoy the plot as much as the first. Regardless, this movie is a blast and delivered on my expectations. Also, stick around for the post credit scene because it is the best one that marvel has made to date.

Disclaimer: I am agnostic on movies, have no special attachment to either Marvel or DC comics (never read comic books), hardly ever go to the theatre to see a film (cheap, usually watch movies for 2.99 on youtube, and use speedup plug in to watch at 2x speed), and usually don't partake of R-rated films.Other than that, I went to the theatre to see this film because I enjoyed the first DP film on youtube so much.Refreshing anti-hero, anti-status-quo approach.How the entire 1500 crew that was needed to produce this film made it hang together so well is sheer ..., well, art. Truly at the peak of capability.There are almost 2 dialogues going on at once, one that follows the main trajectory, and the second dialogue that is all chatter that reflects what goes on in our heads, we that actually use filters before speaking, ha.The campiness factor went right to 11 but never jumps the shark - I am sure that comes with much work on the film. Much care to create a really enjoyable, watchable movie. The 4th-wall breaks are all funny.Ryan Reynolds: 1) I wonder what he ever would have done if he didn't use all this energy and creativity in film, and 2) I wonder how many people out the world miss their real calling.Using an overweight adolescent for a superhero, unbelievable.The only thing that disconnected my suspended disbelief was the incredible asymmetry of disaster. That usually happens in a film like this.I get that the entire mood of the film has to be set using vulgarity and weirdness - I don't have people I know as vulgar as in the movie, so that demands more willing suspended disbelief. Harsh on the ears, much less the weirdness on the eyes. All scenes with Leslie Uggams destroyed me - the comic creativity and imagination blows my mind. No spoilers, though.
As usual marvel make a marvelous movie every moment in the movie was funny

reviews.review_title: Back again with more in your face humour
reviews.content: Deadpool 2 - The craziest superhero is back with his wacky sense of humour, dialogues filled with bajazillion pop culture and movie references if you keep a keen ear to the proceedings, amazing fight sequences, blink n miss cameos, and my new favourite superhero, Domino (she is as badass as they come). This is fun watch with all you would expect from Ryan Reynolds and his screen alter ego gives u worth your tickets n more. Josh Brolin as Cable albeit shorter than the comic guy does well in the role fit for him. The proceeding tend to drag a bit but great overall watch. This movie boasts of the best end credit scene in any Marvel movie ever. Stick around after the initial credits only as there is no final end credit scene (So don't wait up).

reviews.review_title: Deadpool 2 is hilarious, brutal, and surprisingly heartfelt
reviews.content: I won't say much, if you enjoyed "Deadpool" then you will enjoy "Deadpool 2" in terms of comedy. There's a lot of reviews here saying that it's just a rehashed version of the first film, I disagree. I think the comedy here was pretty fresh considering it's a sequel, which generally suffers from trying to replicate a formula that worked before.Yeah, there's fourth-wall breaking, Wade Wilson is still a sarcastic, over-the-top smart-mouth, and the film is full of gratuitous violence - but reapplying those themes that made the first film a success doesn't mean you've created a carbon copy (or even close).There was an actual maturation of Wade Wilson's character throughout the film, while there was very little development of other characters. For the most part, the supporting cast (new or returning characters) is under-developed, with the exception of Cable, who was a great addition to Deadpool's story. Cable has more depth to his character than expected here, and that helped the overall arc of the film feel more gratifying and less antiquated.The big surprise for me was that, in the end, the film was pretty heartfelt - which was a big step for me with the character. Deadpool is an antihero, he's a total a$$hat, but in the end, he's someone who kills bad guys, and it's tough to understand WHY if the character doesn't have SOME heart. That's what this film did well, they added depth to Wade Wilson, they added some heart overall - there was a moment or two that, dare I say, I felt these eyes begin to water, unexpectedly - which was a nice touch that was missing from the first film.If the first film wasn't for you, this one won't be either - the antics still exist, but the formula is different. Reynolds is still prefect for the role, and Josh Brolin is a great addition to a surprisingly complex character. It ain't the Shawshank Redemption here people, but it's a fun ride with a ton of laughs. Sit back, relax and enjoy.

The first one was hilarious and I really wanted to know what they were going to do with this one. There are a few things that I had a problem with in the first Deadpool movie.
1. The jokes were completely over shown in the trailers.
2. The cast and crew had little chemistry in the lack of overall story.
3. The story felt forced by the studio as if to compete with other Marvel Franchises.This movie has none of these problems. Here is how it fixes them.
1. The first 2 trailers were not even about the movie. The Bob Ross and Cable introduction trailers were hilarious and genius in their own right and gave away nothing about the story at all.
2. This movie has a fantastic crew that is natural around one another within the honestly perfect story. Josh Brolin plays off of Ryan Reynolds with no effort needed to be any less than great. The romantic elements in this movie hit hard. The X-Force crew is more of a joke than a plot point. Overall the story finds its place almost immediately and just rolls with it.
3. Someone finally looked at Deadpool and decided that the safest place for it to grow is in the hands of its crew and cast rather than the people at the head of the chain. Thank god.I've seen this movie 4 times and I'd gladly see it again.

The Deadpool movies are always what they say they are. Just in a very unconventional fashion and that's kind of the point, Deadpool is a very unconventional character. It's why we love him.Parent discretion is advised though.Was is DP2 worth seeing in theaters? Absolutely.Would I see it again in theater? See above answer.Is there an end credit? Yep!

I thought James Brolin was really good as Cable, much more personality than Thanos. The real reason I only gave it 7 out of 10, is that the movie tries so hard to go over the top, it was in danger of jumping the shark. Even the opening credits are all about the comedy only. So if you liked Dead Pool, you'll like this movie, but leave the theater wondering how they could do a 3rd film without beginning to either start revamping the same jokes or becoming a parody of itself.

reviews.review_title: Nothing in it but the laughs
reviews.content: I went into this movie with somewhat high expectations of sturdy story telling with a blend of natural jokes that would elicit laughter. I agree that it kept me laughing throughout but I was quite disappointed with the story and the plot. It was a cheesy rip off of the Terminator movies and the plot felt shallow. Given how wonderfully planned Deadpool 1 was, I can't help but feel like that this doesn't live up to the expectations. Somewhere in between mocking other franchises, they forgot to make a movie with an original story line.

This was great. In fact, I liked this more than the first one. Deadpool 2 , since it doesn't have to do the whole origin story thing, can focus more on action and, most importantly, characters. That's actually something that makes this film different than it's predecessor: it focuses more on the characters, their struggles, motivations, and arcs. This makes it more than just another action movie.Ryan Reynolds has continued to prove that he was destined for this role. He absolutely nails it again, but this time, showing more of the merc's emotional side, and allowing him to take a break from making one-liners and have some actual character development. And my, there's a lot of that here.There are lots of new characters here. My favorite of them has to be Cable, played by the always intimidating Josh Brolin. His character comes in almost out of nowhere and instantly declares himself to be a badass on a mission. And despite the advertising and the first third of the film, he actually isn't the main antagonist. That doesn't mean we don't get cool fight scenes of him against Deadpool. Thank goodness for those. If he's going to be in the upcoming X-force movie, I'll be one happy camper.Domino, the other new character, is a perfect middle ground between Deadpool's jokiness and cynicism, and Cable's stoicism and seriousness. The most surprising thing about this character is her 'schtick'. She is extremely lucky, meaning very improbably things always turn out in her favor. Props to the makers of this movie for putting in a useful and unique female character, and not a Black Widow clone. I would love to see her again in a future movie.Overall, this is an R rated superhero movie that stars a trigger-happy Canadian, a grumpy dude with a robot arm, and a very lucky black woman, all the while dealing with themes of loss and family. If you told me this a few years ago, I would have laughed in your face.We are here and now, ladies and gents.

reviews.review_title: Deadpool fans rejoice! They did it again.
reviews.content: I had a really good time with Deadpool 2. It continues with the humour, action and awareness of the original, while also taking all three to the extreme. Action scenes are bigger, more varied and incredibly entertaining. Whilst turning it up to 11 works well for the action, I feel like the meta references and crude humour was stretched to its absolute limit and took me out of the movie occasionally.One thing Deadpool had going for it was the heart, the love story/Wade's mortality elements of the narrative always felt earned. Sadly I do not feel the same way about Deadpool 2. This movie (like many other franchises) throws around the word "family" quite a lot. Whilst the old and new characters are all very entertaining and work well together, I didn't feel like a family was established. Overall I would recommend Deadpool 2 to anyone who enjoyed the original. I know I have my reservations overall, but I agree with my friends initial comment of "I don't think I have giggled so much in the cinema since South Park".
I haven't laughed so hard before! Amazing acting!!

Unlike its predecessor, DP2 is more about a mission which is not against a villain mainly though it was to bring back someone to life. DP himself was going through the extreme pain of loss & regret and still formed a team to fulfill his mission. However the movie's heart, soul & spine is the humor element :)Dead Pool is a selfless mutant who got super heroic powers & abilities after being experimented to heal his cancer but also disfigured him. The first part narration was completely through hilarious voice over by Dead Pool himself, looked innovative. But Dead Pool 2 was ridiculously hilarious, such a charm to watch over the performance of each which turn our smiles to laughs and cherish the cinematic experience inside the hall. While the flick is hilarious - it's emotional too, it goes through loss, guilt & regret ... And in fact the movie starts with the suicide attempt of Dead Pool. It's hard to judge the joner of the film, DP2 is not just a Super hero movie, not an action movie too, not a hard core adult movie either. It's a mix of all, you get to experience extreme action sequences, vulgar killings, Sarcasm (Off course), comedy, thriller to the core etc . The action scenes are glorious without any doubt. It's entertaining in its own way. From the beginning to the end my eyes were glued on to the screen without being bored even for a sec. The movie is filled with small surprises too, like time travel.Everyone performed fantastically, but Ryan Reynolds was great as such an ass kicking super hero. Cinematography was excellent, even on screen we can sense that there are no drop of shadow falling on frame during the scenes in extreme lighting conditions. The edits were crisp as well as the fantastic CGI / VFX deserve appreciation.

I believed that Deadpool 2 has been really overlooked due to Infinity War coming out a few weeks before but after seeing it I see why it made more money in its opening box office weekend - because it was incredible! This was hilarious I couldn't stop laughing from the standard jokes to the subtle and neesh jokes. All the references, gags, just everything had me dying of laughter.All the characters in the film were perfect. Domino is such a cool character I could not get enough of her in action scenes. Zazie portrayed the character phenomenally. Ryan Reynolds of course pulled off Deadpool perfectly and I could not see anyone filling in that role but him. He is just perfect for it. Also, Josh Brolin. KILLED it as the villain once again. Twice in one year he managed to give an interesting character to the audience, even though he isn't really the main protagonist. By far the best surprise was to see the juggernaut in the film. I did run into a spoiler about his appearance but it doesn't change the fact I loved what they did with his character. Definitely did him justice for X-Men: Last Stand.All the subtle hints and easter eggs where on point. Having a brief cameo of the X-Men in the mansion was perfect, the cameo of Brad Pitt which was out of nowhere, some other well known actors such as Terry Crews and Bill Skarsgård were hilarious if only brief. The other easter eggs such as the soundtrack behind Logan's death is also behind Deadpool's death were just perfect. The multiple character references listing from Batman, Thanos, Black Widow, Black Panther, Wolverine. It was all just spot on. The little hints to the director being the one to John Wick and the James Bond type introduction. It just all had me in pieces.The emotion behind the whole of the movie is incredible and it just shows that Deadpool is willing to do whatever to stay with Vanessa after her very unexpected death, which may have been reversed in the after credits? Also, the after credits were perfect. The time travelling Deadpool to save Peter and Vanessa from dying seemed to be adequate for the storyline however the assassination of Deadpool from X-Men Origins: Wolverine and the assassination of Ryan Reynolds after reading the Green Lantern script had me crying. The little things like this just tied the whole movie together - perfectly.Overall I am pleasantly met with my prediction that Deadpool 2 will top the first movie and bring in more laughter and references for us true fans and those wanting to get into a superhero franchise. I genuinely can't wait to hear future news of whether Deadpool 3 will become a thing. But until then all I have to say was this was incredible.

Even though some people may criticize the movie for it's cliched plot. I really enjoyed this movie, I loved the cast and the characters which helped built this movie throughout, making it in my opinion the best Deadpool movie since "Deadpool" in 2016.
 
The action scenes were great but not up to the John Wick style, that David Leitch promised. But they were pretty over-top but realistic at the same-time.
One of my favorite scenes was the prison and the end fight scene and the "Hand-Gun" scene, that was in the first trailer.The comedy in this movie was performed perfectly, the comedy still worked when it came to some serious scene. And the way they change the tone of the film was executed perfectly.The performance is the heart to the film like a blood is to a penis. Ryan Reynolds nails it again as Deadpool, Karan Soni reprise his role as Dopinder which we see more of (WE NEED A PETER and DOPINDER SPINOFF). Josh Brolin does a pretty intimidating and really cool Cable. Zazie Beetz was great and surprisingly interesting as Domino aka The Girl who's Lucky. Rob Delaney was really great being Peter and I hope to see him in future Deadpool or X-Force movies.The plot was really simple to understand, which I really look for in a movie tbh.
I'm not a huge-fan of complicated plot lines, that leaves me confused but some of them are done really well.Deadpool 2 is a FAMILY and ACTION PACKAGED THRILL-RIDE OF FUN with COMEDIC ELEMENTS.

reviews.review_title: Breaking the 4th wall about lazy writing, while still including lazy writing
reviews.content:
This is without a doubt a lost potential. I feel as though if this movie was made in a different time with the same technology, It would in reality deserve the rating which it has. However in this reality - It doesn't. In fact It's a fun but unfunny mess filled with unnecessary social justice self-critique, while still filled with social justice elements like multiculturalism, girl with a short hair which is a lesbian for the sake of being a lesbian and a strong independent woman who just happens that she survives the parachute fall of the X-Force just because it happens that her super power is that. A talentless actor fat kid who stutters and mispronounces, is the main plot of show, but who somehow makes Deadpool want to save him for no apparent reason, while being an anti-hero who for the most part, who doesn't give a crap about anyone except his wife who died. Does Deadpool cared about the people who killed his wife? About their families and kids? Yet he wants to save the fat kid with generic powers, who kills Cable's wife and daughter in the future. And for what reason? Simply to show he helps kids who are discriminated. Good job guys. It's not like this message hasn't been shoved in our face hundreds to thousands of times already.
Not only that, but despite the plot being so ironically lazy, that doesn't excuse it for being lazy.
"That's just lazy writing" - says Deadpool, by breaking the 4th wall when Cable explains why he couldn't have gotten further in the past to save his wife and daughter.
Yeah Reynolds, we get it. How is that going to change the fact that It's lazy writing?Now I know humor is subjective, but this was just filled with jokes that are outdated and cringey.
Just epic. Might me tingle in all the right places ;)
Perfect balance of vulgarity, humour and action. Everything I want in a super hero film.
